BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (PLB) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 0.6 MILE N OF THE CENTER OF THE CITY OF DOVER, ON A HIGH PROMINENT PARTLY-WOODED HILL, LOCALLY KNOWN AS GARRISON HILL PARK, AND ON LAND OWNED BY THE CITY. IT IS 47.5 FEET S OF THE CENTER OF THE GARRISON HILL LOOKOUT TOWER, 43 FEET SW OF THE CENTER OF THE GUN MOUNT ON E SIDE OF THE TOWER, 20 FEET N OF POWER-TRANSMISSION LINE POLE 14, AND ABOUT 200 FEET SE OF THE LARGE CIRCULAR WATER RESERVOIR.  THE DISK IS STAMPED GARRISON HILL 1943 AND IS SET FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  SURFACE, UNDERGROUND, REFERENCE, AND AZIMUTH MARKS ARE BRONZE DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS N OF THE STATION, 33 FEET NW OF THE CENTER OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER.  THE DISK IS STAMPED GARRISON HILL NO 1 1943 AND PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS SE OF THE STATION, 52 FEET SE OF THE CENTER OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER, AND ON THE E SLOPE OF THE HILL. THE DISK IS STAMPED GARRISON HILL NO 2 1943 AND PROJECTS 8 INCHES.  AZIMUTH MARK IS ABOUT 0.45 MILE WNW OF THE STATION, 30 FEET NW OF THE CENTER OF A N-AND-S GRAVEL ROAD, 1 FOOT E OF A N-AND-S FENCELINE, AND 2 FEET S OF A BOARD GATE.  THE DISK IS STAMPED GARRISON HILL 1943 AND PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  TO REACH FROM THE STATION, GO W TO CENTRAL AVENUE, TURN RIGHT AND GO 0.5 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO 0.15 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO 0.15 MILE TO A BOARD GATE IN FENCELINE ON RIGHT, AND MARK.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE INTERSECTION OF CENTRAL AVENUE AND BROADWAY, GO NW ON CENTRAL AVENUE (STATE HIGHWAYS 9 AND 16) FOR 0.9 MILE TO ASCENSION AVENUE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO E UPHILL ON ASCENSION AVENUE FOR 0.3 MILE TO THE LOOKOUT TOWER AND STATION.  OBSERVATIONS MADE FROM A 50-FOOT STEEL TOWER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK - 18 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (JLO) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 0.5 MILE NORTH OF DOVER ON PROPERTY OWNED BY CITY.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE ROUTES 4, 9 AND 16 IN THE CENTER OF DOVER, GO NORTHERLY ON STATE ROUTES 9 AND 16 FOR 0.9 MILE TO A SIDE STREET RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON ASWCENSION AVENUE FOR 0.15 MILE TO A GATE, PASS THROUGH GATE AND CONTINUE UPHILL FOR 0.15 MILE TO A LOOKOUT TOWER AND THE STATION.  GARRISON HILL 1943 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED--GARRISON HILL 1943-SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH IS 3-INCHES UNDERGROUND.  IT IS THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF A DRIVEWAY AROUND THE LOOKOUT TOWER,  24 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE WIRE FENCE AROUND THE LOOKOUT TOWER AND 18.8 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 14-13 WHICH HAS TWO TRANSFORMERS ON IT.  THE 1943 DESCRIPTION STATES THAT AN UNDERGROUND DISK WAS SET.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED--GARRISON HILL NO 1 1943--SET IN THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE.  IT IS 44 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE FENCE AROUND A MICROWAVE TOWER, 39 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF POWERLINE POLE NUMBER 14 A AND 9.5 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE FENCE AROUND THE LOOKOUT TOWER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1981 (PDU) SEARCHED FOR FOR 2 HOURS WITH COMPASS, TAPE, AND CLAMMING FORK AND DESCRIPTION.  BOTH REFERENCE MARKS UNABLE TO BE FOUND.  DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--0.6 MILE N OF CENTRE OF CITY OF DOVER.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) THERE IS NO HOUSE WITH CUPOLA IN THIS VICINITY.  TWO BARNS, HOWEVER, IN THE VICINITY HAVE CUPOLAS AND ONE OF THESE IS PROBABLY THE STATION.  THE BARNS WITH CUPOLAS ARE VERY CLOSE TOGETHER AND WHICH ONE IS THE STATION WAS NOT DETERMINED. IT IS BELIEVED THAT THIS STATION IS UNDISTURBED AND IS STILL USEFUL.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (PLB) THE STATION IS THE LOOKOUT TOWER, LOCATED ABOUT 0.6 MILES NORTH OF THE CENTER OF TOWN ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF A PARTLY WOODED HILL IN GARRISON HILL PARK, AND ON LAND OWNED BY THE CITY.  IT IS AN 8-LEGGED STEEL STRUCTURE ABOUT 75 FEET HIGH, WITH A PAGODA SHAPED TOP, AND A METAL CUPOLA.  THE STAIRS ARE INSIDE THE STRUCTURE LEADING TO THE TOP.  THE ENTIRE STRUCTURE IS PAINTED GREEN.  POINT OBSERVED UPON, THE SPIRE ON THE APEX OF THE METAL CUPOLA.  LOCATED TO TRIANGULATION STATION GARRISON HILL BY DISTANCE AND DIRECTION.
PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (WER) STATION IS APPROXIMATELY 0.75 MILE EAST OF GORHAM, 0.2 MILE NORTH OF U.S. HIGHWAY 2, JUST SOUTH OF THE ANDROSCOGGIN RIVER, ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE GOLF COURSE AND IN THE SOUTH EDGE OF THE WOODS ALONG FAIRWAY NO. 3.  TO REACH FROM THE CAUTION LIGHT WHICH IS ONE BLOCK NORTH OF THE POST OFFICE IN GORHAM, GO EASTERLY ON U.S. HIGHWAY 2 FOR 0.55 MILE TO THE BRIDGE OVER THE PEABODY RIVER, CONTINUE EASTERLY ON U.S. HIGHWAY 2 FOR 0.1 MILE TO A METAL GATE (ENTRANCE INTO GOLF COURSE) AND THE AZIMUTH MARK ON THE LEFT.  PASS THROUGH METAL GATE AND GO NORTHEAST FOR 0.2 MILE TO THE SOUTH EDGE OF WOODS, A ROAD LEADING INTO THE WOODS AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  STATION MARKS ARE STANDARD DISKS STAMPED GORHAM 1958.  THE SURFACE DISK IS SET IN A SQUARE CONCRETE POST WHICH PROJECTS 2 INCHES.  IT IS 108 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF NO. 3 GREEN, 72 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF A 20-INCH ELM TREE, 43 FEET WEST-SOUTHWEST OF A TRACK ROAD AND 6 FEET SOUTHEAST OF A 6-INCH BEECH TREE WITH TRIANGLE BLAZE.  THE UNDERGROUND DISK IS SET IN AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 48 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  A STANDARD WITNESS POST WAS SET 5 FEET NORTH OF THE MARK.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GORHAM NO 1 1958, IS SET IN A SQUARE CONCRETE POST WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  IT IS 26 FEET WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE CENTER OF WOODS ROAD AND APPROXIMATELY 1 FOOT LOWER IN ELEVATION THAN THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GORHAM NO 2 1958, IS SET IN A SQUARE CONCRETE POST WHICH PROJECTS 4 INCHES.  IT IS 41 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A 20-INCH ELM TREE, 5.5 FEET WEST OF A 8-INCH BEECH TREE AND AT THE SOUTH EDGE OF WOODS.  AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GORHAM 1958, IS SET IN A SQUARE CONCRETE POST WHICH PROJECTS 3 INCHES.  IT IS 31 FEET NORTH-NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF U.S. HIGHWAY 2, APPROXIMATELY 0.05 MILE WEST-NORTHWEST OF A RAILROAD CROSSING, 17 FEET EAST-NORTHEAST OF THE CENTER OF A METAL GATE AND DRIVEWAY AND 1 FOOT NORTH-NORTHEAST OF A FENCE LINE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1981 (CLN) THE STATION MARK, REFERENCE MARK 2 AND THE AZIMUTH MARK WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 1, WAS FOUND TILTED OVER.  THE MARK WAS STRAIGHTENED UP AND USED AS REFERENCE MARK 3.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS IN THE WAY OF HIGHWAY CONSTRUCTION.  AZIMUTH MARK 2 WAS ESTABLISHED AND THE OLD AZIMUTH MARK DESTROYED.  A LOWER DISTANCE OF 0.010 METER (0.033 FT) WAS NOTED TO REFERENCE MARK 2 AND A HIGHER VALUE OF 7 MINUTES AND 36 SECONDS WAS NOTED IN THE DIRECTION TO THE MARK.  THE MARK MAY HAVE BEEN HIT BY GRADING EQUIPMENT DURING CONSTRUCTION WORK ON THE GOLF COURSE.  A NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.2 KM (0.75 MI) EAST OF GORHAM, 0.3 KM (0.20 MI) NORTH OF U.S. HIGHWAY 2 AND JUST SOUTH OF THE ANDROS COGGIN RIVER.  IT IS ON A GOLF COURSE, NEAR A NEWLY CONSTRUCTED SAND TRAP AND JUST SOUTH OF A POND IN FRONT OF A NEW GREEN.  OWNERSHIP--ANDROS COGGIN VALLEY COUNTRY CLUB, GORHAM, NEW HAMPSHIRE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 2 AND STATE HIGHWAY 16 IN THE EAST PART OF GORHAM, GO EAST ON HIGHWAY 2 FOR 0.5 KM (0.30 MI) TO A BRIDGE.  CONTINUE EAST ON HIGHWAY 2 FOR 0.2 KM (0.10 MI) TO A METAL GATE ON THE LEFT LEADING INTO GOLF COURSE AND THE AZIMUTH MARK AS DESCRIBED.  THIS GATE IS 0.1 KM (0.05 MI) EAST OF THE CLUB HOUSE FOR THE GOLF COURSE.  TURN LEFT PASS THROUGH GATE AND GO NORTHEAST ON A TRACK ROAD FOR 0.3 KM (0.20 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1986)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1986 (REP) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED ON THIS DATE.  NO OTHER MARKS WERE SEARCHED FOR AT THIS TIME.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.9 KM (1.2 MI) EAST OF GORHAM, 0.3 KM (0.2 MI) NORTH OF U.S. HIGHWAY 2 AND ON THE NORTH SIDE OF A GOLF COURSE, ALONG FAIRWAY NUMBER 3.  OWNERSHIP--ANDROSCOGGIN VALLEY COUNTRY CLUB, PHONE 603-466-9468.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN GORHAM, GO EASTERLY ON U.S. HIGHWAY 2 FOR 0.8 KM (0.5 MI) TO THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 16 SOUTH, CONTINUE AHEAD FOR 0.6 KM (0.35 MI) TO A BRIDGE, CONTINUE AHEAD FOR 0.2 KM (0.1 MI) TO THE GOLF COURSE ON THE LEFT. TURN LEFT, THEN RIGHT AND GO NORTHEAST ON A DIM TRACK ROAD ACROSS THE COURSE FOR 0.3 KM (0.2 MI) TO THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---GORHAM 1958---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT 30 CM ON SIDE FLUSH WITH GROUND. LOCATED 34.7 METERS (114.0 FT) WEST-SOUTHWEST FROM THE SOUTH EDGE OF A SMALL POND, 19.5 METERS (64.0 FT) WEST-NORTHWEST FROM A 2 METER IN DIAMETER ELM TREE AND 14.3 METERS (47.0 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE EAST SIDE OF A SAND TRAP.  THE UNDERGROUND MARK WAS NOT SEARCHED FOR.  FAA AIRPORT SURVEYS, NEW ENGLAND, SEPTEMBER-OCTOBER 1986.  THIS STATION IS SUITABLE FOR GPS SURVEYS.  DESCRIBED BY J.N. LEONHARDT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1986)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1986 THE STATION IS LOCATED IN GORHAM, 1.9 KM (1.20 MI) EAST OF GORHAM CENTER, 0.3 KM (0.20 MI) NORTH OF U.S. ROUTE 2, ON FAIRWAY NUMBER 1 OF THE ANDROSCOGGIN VALLEY COUNTRY CLUB, PHONE 603-466-9468. TURN LEFT AND PARK AT CLUB HOUSE AND OBTAIN PERMISSION FROM CLUB PRO.  FROM HERE PACK EQUIPMENT NORTHEAST ALONG FAIRWAY NUMBER 1 TO THE NUMBER ONE GREEN, A SMALL POND AND THE STATION SOUTH OF THE POND.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---GORHAM 1958---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A 30-CM SQUARE CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH THE GROUND. LOCATED 34.7 M (113.8 FT) WEST-SOUTHWEST FROM THE SOUTH EDGE OF A SMALL POND, 19.5 M (64.0 FT) WEST-NORTHWEST FROM A 6-FT DIAMETER ELM TREE AND 14.3 M (46.9 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE EAST SIDE OF A SAND TRAP. STATION RECOVERY (2013)  RECOVERY NOTE BY PROFESSIONAL LAND SURVEYOR 2013 (JRO) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  NOTE-COOPERATIVE FOLKS AT COUNTRY CLUB LOANED A GOLF CART TO RIDE OUT TO THE MARK.

TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF U.S.  HIGHWAY 2 AND STATE HIGHWAY 16, IN THE EAST PART OF GORHAM, GO EAST ON HIGHWAY 2 FOR 0.5 KM (0.30 MI) TO A BRIDGE, CONTINUE EAST ON HIGHWAY 2 FOR 0.2 KM (0.10 MI) TO A METAL GATE ON THE LEFT LEADING INTO THE GOLF COURSE AND THE MARK AS DESCRIBED. THE MARK IS 304 FT (92.7 M) EAST OF THE SIGN AT THE DRIVEWAY TO THE ANDROSCOGGIN VALLEY COUNTRY CLUB, 55 FT (16.8 M) EAST-NORTHEAST OF POLE 37 OVER 4, NORTH AND ACROSS ROUTE 2 FROM A POINT THAT IS 53 FT (16.2 M) EAST OF MILEPOST 26.8, 21.5 FT (6.6 M) SOUTHWEST OF A GAS PIPELINE MARKER ALSO USED TO MARK GOLF COURSE OUT OF BOUNDS, 19.5 FT (5.9 M) SOUTHEAST OF ANOTHER PIPELINE MARKER, 8 FT (2.4 M) SOUTH OF A TRACK ROAD THAT PARALLELS ROUTE 2, 6 FT (1.8 M) LOWER THAN THE HIGHWAY.  NOTE-POSITION FROM OPUS-RS SOLUTION - LATITUDE 44 23 9.72201, WEST LONGITUDE 71 9 46.98423, EL HGT 208.240 M (63.5 FT). ALSO OCCUPIED AS A BENCH MARK ON THE WAY TO F 47. N OF THE NE CORNER OF A HOUSE, AND ABOUT 12 FT. SW OF THE EDGE OF THE BLUFF.  IT IS A STANDARD REFERENCE-MARK DISK, SET IN THE TOP OF A CONCRETE POST FLUSH WITH THE LAWN. BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (WER) THE STATE FOREST SERVICE LOOKOUT TOWER IS ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF THE EFFINGHAM POST OFFICE, ON THE SUMMIT OF GREEN MOUNTAIN.  A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE FROM TRIANGULATION STATION GREEN MT. 2 TO THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER, DISTANCE BEING 0.840 METER (2.75 FEET) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF STATION GREEN MT. 2.  THE LOOKOUT TOWER IS A SQUARE WOODEN CABIN SUPPORTED BY A FOUR-LEGGED STEEL STRUCTURE AND IS ABOUT 35 FEET IN HEIGHT OVERALL.  AN ANGLE IRON SET IN A SQUARE CONCRETE BLOCK AT CENTER OF TOWER WAS MEASURED AS THE APPROXIMATE CENTER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (JLO) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY W.E.R. IN 1958. A TRAVERSE CONNECTION WAS MADE FROM TRIANGULATION STATION GREEN MT 2 TO THE APPROXIMATE CENTER OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER, DISTANCE BEING 0.837 METER.  DESCRIBED BY GREGORY S. NELSON.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2004 (JKS) STATION WAS RECOVERED AT DESCRIBED LOCATION IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (WER) THE STATION IS ABOUT 2-1/2 MILES SOUTHEAST OF EFFINGHAM FALLS AND 2-1/2 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF EFFINGHAM POST OFFICE, ON TOP OF GREEN MOUNTAIN, UNDER THE GREEN MOUNTAIN LOOKOUT TOWER, AND IS ON STATE FORREST SERVICE PROPERTY.  TO REACH FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 25 AND 153 IN THE VILLAGE OF EFFINGHAM, GO WESTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 25 FOR 0.2 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON LEFT AT A CHURCH.  TURN LEFT, GO 0.15 MILE TO A ROAD FORK.  TAKE LEFT FORK, GO 0.05 MILE TO A T-ROAD JUNCTION.  TURN LEFT AND GO 0.1 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT WHICH LEADS TO A GROUP OF BUILDINGS.  KEEP STRAIGHT AHEAD FOR 0.05 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT. TURN RIGHT AND GO, UP HILL, FOR 0.5 MILE TO A STATE FOREST SERVICE BUILDING AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  PACK SOUTHERLY ON A TRACK ROAD FOR ABOUT 1/4 MILE TO A ROCK LEDGE AND THE BEGINNING OF A FOOT TRAIL.  CONTINUE SOUTHERLY ON FOOT TRAIL TO SUMMIT AND THE STATION.  ABOUT A 45 MINUTE PACK.  STATION MARK IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED GREEN MT 2 1958, CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN BED ROCK AND IS 6 INCHES BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  IT IS 8.2 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE NORTHWEST LEG OF LOOKOUT TOWER, 12 FEET NORTHEAST OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF LOOKOUT TOWER, 11.6 FEET NORTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF LOOKOUT TOWER, AND 7.8 FEET SOUTHWEST OF THE NORTHEAST LEG OF LOOKOUT TOWER.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GREEN MT 2 NO 1 1958, IS CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER WHICH IS 4 FEET BY 2 FEET AND PROJECTS ABOUT 6 INCHES.  IT IS 42 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF LOOKOUT TOWER AND 14 FEET EAST OF AN ANCHOR BOLT WHICH HOLDS THE GUY WIRE FOR THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF TOWER.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GREEN MT 2 NO 2 1958, IS CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER WHICH IS 6 FEET BY 3 FEET AND PROJECTS ABOUT 10 INCHES.  IT IS 38 FEET WEST OF THE NORTHWEST LEG OF LOOKOUT TOWER AND 3 FEET SOUTH OF A FOOT PATH BETWEEN SHELTER AND LOOKOUT TOWER.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 6.9 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1960)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US FOREST SERVICE 1960 (FSB) RECOVERED STATION AS DESCRIBED.  ENROUTE TO STATION IT WAS FOUND THAT THE MILEAGE--TURN LEFT AND GO 0.1 MILE--IN THE TO REACH OF THE DESCRIPTION, SHOULD READ--TURN LEFT AND GO 1.1 MILE.  ALSO IN THE TO REACH, FOLLOWING THE WORDS--WHICH LEADS TO A GROUP OF BUILDINGS, ADD THE WORDS--WHICH IS HIGHWATCH MTN. CAMP.  THE STATION MARK WAS NOT FOUND AS INDICATED.  INSTEAD A STANDARD USC AND GS TABLET STAMPED GREEN MTN. 2 1958 WAS FOUND WELDED ON A THREE FOOT LENGTH OF PIPE.  THE PIPE WAS FOUND LYING OUT NEAR REFERENCE MARK 1.  REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1976)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1976 (JLO) THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED. A DIFFERENCE OF 2 MINUTES AND 10 SECONDS WAS NOTED IN THE DIRECTION BETWEEN THE REFERENCE MARKS. A DIFFERENCE OF 0.004 METER WAS NOTED IN THE DISTANCE TO REFERENCE MARK 1 AND A DIFF- ERENCE OF 0.020 METER WAS NOTED IN THE DISTANCE TO REFERENCE MARK 2. REFERENCE MARK 1 IS LOOSE IN THE GROUND AND REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A FLAT BOULDER, MOBIL ON TOP OF THE GROUND. A COMPLETE DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ATOP GREEN MOUNTAIN, ABOUT 2.5 MILES SOUTHEAST OF EFFINGHAM FALLS, 2.5 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF EFFINGHAM AND IS ON PROPERTY OF THE NEW HAMPSHIRE STATE FOREST SERVICE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN PORTER MAINE, GO WESTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 25 FOR 3.0 MILE TO THE STATE LINE, CONTINUE WESTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY 25 FOR 2.35 MILE TO THE JUNCTION WITH STATE HIGHWAY 153, CONTINUE WESTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAYS 25 AND 153 FOR 0.25 MILE TO A GRAVEL SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHERLY ON THE GRAVEL ROAD FOR 0.75 MILE TO A TRACK ROAD LEFT AND A LOCKED GATE. FROM HERE PACK EASTERLY FOR 0.5 MILE TO A STORAGE GARAGE AND A JEEP TRAIL, CONTINUE PACKING UP HILL ON THE JEEP TRAIL FOR ABOUT 0.5 MILE TO THE TOP OF THE MOUNTAIN, A LOOKOUT TOWER AND THE STATION. ABOUT A 1 HOUR PACK.  STATION MARK, STAMPED---GREEN MT 2 1958---, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN BEDROCK. IT IS 6 INCHES BELOW THE GROUND SURFACE AND 2.75 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE ANGLE IRON AT THE CENTER OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER.  REFERENCE MARK 1, STAMPED---GREEN MT NO 1 1958---, IS A STANDARD DISK CEMENTED IN A 2 BY 3 FOOT BOULDER THAT PROJECTS ABOUT 8 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND SURFACE. IT IS 42.0 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER AND IS ABOUT 5 FEET LOWER THAN THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2, STAMPED---GREEN MT NO 2 1958---, IS A STAND- ARD DISK CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A 3 BY 5 FOOT FLAT BOULDER THAT IS ON TOP OF THE GROUND. IT IS 38.0 FEET WEST OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER AND IS ABOUT 5 FEET LOWER THAN THE STATION.  THERE WAS NO SUITABLE LOCATION FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK.  THE DISTANCE BETWEEN REFERENCE MARKS WAS NOT MEASURED DUE TO TERRAIN AND BRUSH.  THE HEIGHT OF THE LIGHT ABOVE THE MARK WAS 10.0 METERS.  DESCRIBED BY G. E. NELSON.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2004 (JKS) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.   MAIN MARK WAS FOUND AT DESCRIBED LOCATION, BURIED, IN GOOD CONDITION. IT WAS DUG UP, PHOTOGRAPHED AND REBURIED.   RM NO.1 WAS FOUND AT DESCRIBED LOCATION BUT IS IN POOR CONDITION DUE TO HEAVY HIKING ACTIVITY.   RM NO.2 WAS FOUND AT DESCRIBED LOCATION IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) STATION RECOVERED UNCHANGED.  THIS STATION IS LOCATED IN THE TOWN OF GREENLAND ABOUT 0.3 MILE SW OF THE RAILROAD STATION IN GREENLAND.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1886 ON THE HILL OF THE SAME NAME ABOUT 6 MILES FROM LOWELL TO THE LEFT OF THE MAMMOTH ROAD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (FLP) IN THE WESTERN PART OF THE TOWN OF PELHAM, ABOUT 2 MILES SOUTHWESTERLY FROM THE CENTRAL BUSINESS DISTRICT AND ABOUT 3/4 MILE WEST FROM THE MAMMOTH ROAD, ON THE NORTHERN EDGE OF THE SUMMIT OF GUMPUS HILL, A STATION MARKED BY A 7/8 INCH DRILLHOLE 2 INCHES DEEP IN A FLAT ROCK ABOUT 2.5 FEET SQUARE AND 2 OR 3 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  THE STATION WAS COVERED WITH A LARGE PILE OF ROCKS.  ABOUT 15 METERS NORTH FROM THE STATION AND BETWEEN THE STATION AND GUMPUS POND THERE IS A VERY LARGE ROCK ABOUT 6 FEET HIGH.  THE HILL IS COVERED WITH AN EXTREMELY HEAVY GROWTH OF JUNIPER TREES OR BUSHES AND WITH MANY TALL TREES.  A TOWER OR SIGNAL 30 TO 40 FEET HIGH WOULD BE NECESSARY IN ORDER TO USE THE STATION.  THE STATION IS BEST REACHED BY FOLLOWING WESTERLY A DIRT ROAD, WHICH LEADS OFF THE MAMMOTH ROAD NEARLY OPPOSITE A CEMETERY ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE MAMMOTH ROAD, TO A POINT ABOUT 3/4 MILE FROM THE MAMMOTH ROAD, AND THEN NORTHERLY UP THE HILL ALONG A CART PATH TO A POINT ABOUT 400 FEET NORTHERLY OF THE HIGHEST PART OF THE PATH, WHERE THERE IS A LARGE OPENING IN THE STONE WALL AT THE SOUTHEAST SIDE OF THE PATH, AND THEN DIRECTLY UP THE HILL TO THE SUMMIT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (RHA) THE STATION WAS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.  IT IS LOCATED AT ABOUT THE CENTER OF THE FLAT TOP OF GUMPUS HILL. THE HILL IS ENTIRELY WOODED OVER, THE TOP BEING COVERED WITH YOUNG BIRCHES AND GROUND PINE.  THE STATION MAY BE LOCATED BY SEVERAL SMALL ROCKS PILED OVER THE DRILL HOLE.  TWO GIANT BOULDERS ARE LOCATED 38 FEET NORTH-NORTHWEST OF THE STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1961)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RCY) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY F.L.P. IN 1934.  PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION ADEQUATE.  A 3 FT. CAIRN WAS BUILT BESIDE THE DRILL HOLE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1981)  RECOVERY NOTE BY LOCAL ENGINEER (INDIVIDUAL OR FIRM) 1981 (KPM) 7/8 INCH DRILLED HOLE, 2 INCH DEEP.  THERE IS A 1961 PENNY IN THE HOLE.  PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION LISTED A 3 FT. CAIRN WAS FOUND TO BE ONLY 18 INCHES HIGH.  THE HOLE IS 38 FT. FROM THE BOULDER THAT IS ALMOST DUE NORTH.  DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--2 MILES S-W FROM THE CENTER OF PELHAM.                            STATION RECOVERY (2004)  RECOVERY NOTE BY INDIVIDUAL CONTRIBUTORS 2004 FOUND STATION WITH TWO PENNIES IN THE HOLE                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (RG) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THREE PENNIES WERE FOUND IN THE HOLE - 1961, 1977 AND 2000.  THERE WAS AN 18 INCH BOULDER NEXT TO THE HOLE, BUT NO CAIRN.   TO REACH THE STATION GO ABOUT .4 MILES ON GUMPUS HILL ROAD FROM MONMOUTH ROAD IN PELHAM.  THERE IS A WOODS ROAD ON THE RIGHT OPPOSITE A RED SHED AD NO. 19A.  PROCEED ON FOOT ON THE WOODS ROAD ABOUT .4 MILES TO THE HEIGHT OF LAND.  A FAINT ROAD LEADS TO THE RIGHT.  FOLLOW THIS ROAD TO THE NEAREST POINT TO THE TOP AND THEN PROCEED ABOUT 100 YARDS CROSS COUNTRY TO THE TOP OF THE HILL AND THE STATION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1878 IN THE TOWNSHIP OF GUILFORD, ABOUT 5 MILES IN AN EASTERLY DIRECTION FROM LACONIA ON THE LAND OWNED BY COL. BENJAMIN F. WEEKS, ABOUT 2,440 FEET ABOVE THE MEAN-SEA LEVEL.  THE ASCENT OF THE MOUNTAIN IS QUITE STEEP ON ALL SIDES, BUT LEAST STEEP ON THE WESTERN SLOPE WHERE A ROAD WAS CONSTRUCTED IN THE FALL OF 1859.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A COPPER BOLT IN THE ROCK AT THE SUMMIT OF THE MOUNTAIN.  THE ASTRONOMICAL OBSERVATORY WAS PLACED ABOUT 100 FEET TO THE NORTHWARD ON A BARE ROCK.  IN 1878 ANOTHER BOLT WAS PLACED 0.635 METER FROM THE STATION, N 88 DEG 45 MIN W.                            STATION RECOVERY (1931)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1931 (HSS) THE STATION IS ON WHAT IS KNOWN AS BELKNAP MOUNTAIN, THE NAME GUNSTOCK NOW BEING APPLIED TO A PEAK ABOUT 3/4 MILE TO THE NW.  I WENT TO THE MOUNTAIN ON SEPT. 29, 1931 AND FOUND NO COPPER BOLTS ON THE SUMMIT, BUT THERE WERE NUMEROUS DRILL HOLES, ONE OF WHICH I THOUGHT MIGHT BE THE STATION, AS THERE WAS ANOTHER HOLE 2.13 FEET E OF IT, WHICH WAS ABOUT 0.05 FEET GREATER THAN THE 0.635 METER GIVEN IN THE PRINTED DESCRIPTION. I STARTED TO MEASURE THE DISTANCES TO OTHER DRILL HOLES, BUT BECAME DISCOURAGED WHEN, IN A CASUAL SEARCH, I FOUND AT LEAST 21 OF THEM, WITHIN 50 FEET OR SO OF THE 2 HOLES MENTIONED ABOVE.  PROBABLY SOME OF THESE HOLES MAY BE REFERENCE OR RANGE HOLES, AND IF ANY INFORMATION ABOUT THEM IS AVAILABLE I SHALL TRY TO VISIT THE MOUNTAIN AGAIN NEXT YEAR.  THE FIRE TOWER WAS A LITTLE W OF N AND ABOUT 44-1/2 FEET DISTANT FROM THE DRILL HOLE WHICH I THOUGHT MIGHT BE THE STATION, THIS DISTANCE BEING SOMEWHAT GREATER THAN WOULD BE INDICATED BY THE GEOGRAPHIC POSITION OF THE TOWER, WHICH WAS USED BY THE U.S.G.S. AS AN UNOCCUPIED STATION IN 1916-18. THERE IS A GOOD VIEW IN ALL DIRECTIONS FROM THE SUMMIT.  THE STATION MAY BE REACHED BY EITHER OF TWO TRAILS WHICH LEAD TO THE FIRE TOWER, ONE ON THE LACONIA SIDE AND THE OTHER ON THE NE SIDE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1932)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1932 (HSS) I RECOVERED THIS STATION ON JUNE 15, 1932, THE COPPER BOLT BEING STILL FIRMLY IN PLACE. THE BOLT HAD BEEN FOUND BY THE FIRE WATCHMAN, WHOSE INTEREST HAD BEEN AROUSED BY AN UNSUCCESSFUL SEARCH WHICH I HAD MADE ABOUT A MONTH BEFORE, AND HE REPORTED THAT THE BOLT HAD BEEN COVERED WITH DIRT AND THAT IT HAD BEEN PARTLY HIDDEN BY A THIN LAYER OF CEMENT.  I NOTICED THE CEMENT ON THE LEDGE AROUND THE BOLT AND I FOUND A ROUGH CONCRETE BLOCK LYING NOT FAR AWAY.  THIS WAS ABOUT 2 FEET HIGH, WITH A TRIANGULAR BASE, AND IT HAD EVIDENTLY ONCE SERVED AS A MONUMENT CEMENTED OVER THE STATION.  I HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO ASCERTAIN WHO BUILT IT.  I REPLACED IT OVER THE BOLT, BUT THERE IS NO ASSURANCE THAT IT WILL REMAIN IN PLACE, AS IT IS NOT FASTENED IN ANY WAY.  I FOUND ABOUT 40 DRILL HOLES, ALL BUT ABOUT 2 OF WHICH WERE WITHIN 50 FEET OF THE STATION, AND I IDENTIFIED 7 OF THESE AS BEING RANGE HOLES WHICH ARE SHOWN ON THE SKETCH IN THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION OF THE STATION.  THE AZIMUTHS AND DISTANCES CHECKED NICELY.  I FOUND THE BOLT OF 1878, MENTIONED IN THE PRINTED DESCRIPTION, AND IT WAS RUSTY AND EVIDENTLY OF IRON.  THE CENTER OF THE STEEL FIRE TOWER IS, ACCORDING TO MY MEASUREMENTS, 56.45 FEET FROM THE STATION, IN AZIMUTH ABOUT 167-1/2 DEG, AND THIS FORMS A CONVENIENT WAY OF FINDING THE STATION.  THREE DRILL HOLES ARE QUITE NEAR THE STATION, AS FOLLOWS-- 1.52 FEET, 22-1/2 DEG.  1.62 FEET, 145 DEG.  2.46 FEET, 221 DEG.  THESE AZIMUTHS WERE DETERMINED ONLY VERY ROUGHLY, TO GIVE A GENERAL IDEA OF THE LOCATION OF THE HOLES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1933)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1933 (HSS) THIS NOTE IS SUPPLEMENTARY TO THE ONE WHICH I PREPARED IN 1932, SOON AFTER I RECOVERED THE STATION.  IN THAT NOTE I MENTIONED A CONCRETE MONUMENT WHICH I FOUND LYING NEAR THE STATION AND WHICH HAD EVIDENTLY ONCE BEEN PLACED OVER THE STATION. I WAS AT THAT TIME UNABLE TO LEARN WHO BUILT THE MONUMENT, BUT ON A RECENT VISIT TO THE WASHINGTON OFFICE I FOUND A RECORD WHICH SHOWED THAT IT HAD BEEN CONSTRUCTED BY THE PARTY OF A.T. MOSMAN, IN 1897.  IT WAS DESCRIBED AS A PIER 4-1/2 FEET HIGH, ON WHICH A THEODOLITE HAD BEEN SUPPORTED, BUT THE PIECE WHICH I FOUND WAS ONLY ABOUT 2 FEET HIGH AND THEREFORE, ONLY A PART OF THE ORIGINAL STRUCTURE.  THE PEAK ON WHICH THE STATION IS LOCATED IS NOW CALLED BELKNAP MOUNTAIN AND ANOTHER PEAK ABOUT 3/4 MILE TO THE NW IS CALLED GUNSTOCK MOUNTAIN.                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (WER) STATION MARK, A COPPER BOLT WHICH IS SURROUNDED BY A TRIANGLE CHISLED IN THE OUTCROPPING BEDROCK WAS RECOVERED AND FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 AND REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 WERE ESTABLISHED BY THIS PARTY.  FOLLOWING IS A NEW AND COMPLETE DESCRIPTION AND A DIAGRAM OF THE STATION AND THE DRILL HOLES WHICH SURROUNDS IT.  STATION IS APPROXIMATELY 5.25 MILES EAST OF LACONIA, 3.0 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GILFORD, 0.75 MILE SOUTHEAST OF GUNSTOCK MOUNTAIN AND ON THE SUMMIT OF BELKNAP MOUNTAIN.  TO REACH FROM THE POST OFFICE IN LACONIA, GO EAST ON CHURCH STREET FOR 0.25 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 3 AND STATE HIGHWAY 11, BEAR LEFT AND GO NORTHERLY ON U.S. HIGHWAY 3 AND STATE HIGHWAY 11 FOR 0.15 MILE TO THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 3, STATE HIGHWAY 11 AND STATE HIGHWAY 11A AT GILFORD AVENUE ON THE RIGHT, TURN RIGHT ON STATE HIGHWAY 11A (GILFORD AVENUE) AND GO 2.9 MILES TO A CAUTION LIGHT AT CROSSROAD IN THE VILLAGE OF GILFORD, TURN RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON MAIN ROAD FOR 1.3 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD ON THE RIGHT (BELKNAP MOUNTAIN ROAD) AND A SIGN ON RIGHT DEAD END ROAD, TURN RIGHT ON GRAVEL ROAD AND GO 0.45 MILE TO A REVERSE FORK ON THE RIGHT, CONTINUE ON GRAVEL ROAD FOR 0.6 MILE TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT AT SIGN BELKNAP MT. ROAD AND LOOKOUT TOWER, TURN LEFT AND GO 1.7 MILES TO A GARAGE AND A DIM ROAD WHICH CONTINUES TO THE LEFT OF GARAGE, PASS TO THE LEFT OF THE GARAGE ON THE DIM ROAD AND GO 0.05 MILE TO A SMALL SIGN ON THE LEFT WHICH READS FIRE LOOKOUT AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE FOLLOW THE TRAIL WHICH IS MARKED WITH RED PAINT EASTERLY TO THE SUMMIT OF BELKNAP MOUNTAIN AND THE STATION AS DESCRIBED.  STATION MARK, A COPPER BOLT WHICH IS SURROUNDED BY A TRIANGLE CHISLED IN THE OUTCROPPING BEDROCK.  IT IS 53 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF LOOKOUT TOWER, 47 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF LOOKOUT TOWER AND 25 FEET EAST OF A GUY PEG WHICH IS EMBEDDED IN THE BEDROCK.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GUNSTOCK NO 1 1860, IS CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK. IT IS 34 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF LOOKOUT TOWER.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GUNSTOCK NO 2 1860, IS CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN OUTCROPPING BEDROCK. IT IS 39.5 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF LOOKOUT TOWER AND 16.5 FEET NORTHEAST OF A GUY PEG WHICH IS EMBEDDED IN THE BEDROCK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1965)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1965 (DCW) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1978)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1978 (GEL) THE STATION MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION TO REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 CHECKED THE 1958 DATA.  THE IRON BOLT OF 1878 WAS NOT FOUND AT THIS TIME AND IS BELIEVED TO BE GONE.  THE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION TO MT BELKNAP LOOKOUT TOWER COMPARED FAVORABLE TO THE 1958 DATA. FOLLOWING IS A NEW DESCRIPTION.  THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 5-1/4 MILES EAST OF LACONIA, 4 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GILFORD, 3/4 MILE SOUTHEAST OF GUNSTOCK MOUNTAIN AND IS ON THE SUMMIT OF BELKNAP MOUNTAIN, PERMISSION TO BUILD A 20-FOOT PECK TOWER WAS OBTAINED FROM THE NEW HAMPSHIRE FOREST SERVICE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE TOWN HALL IN THE CENTER OF GILFORD VILLAGE, GO WESTERLY ON POTTER HILL ROAD FOR 0.05 MILE.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHERLY ON BELKNAP MOUNTAIN ROAD FOR 1.3 MILES TO WHERE THE ROAD TURNS TO THE RIGHT AND A DEAD-END ROAD STRAIGHT AHEAD AND SIGN WEEKS ROAD.  TURN RIGHT AND GO WESTERLY ON BELKNAP MOUNTAIN ROAD FOR 1.1 MILES TO A SIDE ROAD LEFT.  TURN LEFT AND GO SOUTHEAST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 0.9 MILE TO WHERE THE PAVEMENT ENDS AT A SMALL BRIDGE.  CONTINUE AHEAD NORTH AND EAST ON A WINDING GRAVEL ROAD FOR 0.7 MILE TO A LOCKED CABLE ACROSS THE ROAD AND A PARKING AREA ON THE LEFT.  CONTINUE AHEAD NORTHERLY THROUGH THE GATE FOR 0.1 MILE TO A TRACK ROAD ON THE RIGHT, JUST AFTER PASSING A SMALL SHED ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND PACK EASTERLY UPHILL ON A VERY STEEP AND ROCKY ROAD FOR ABOUT 0.7 MILE TO THE TOP OF THE HILL AND THE STATION.  A 4-WHEEL DRIVE JEEP WAS DRIVEN TO THE TOP AT THIS TIME.  STATION MARK, A COPPER BOLT WHICH IS SURROUNDED BY A TRIANGLE CHISELED IN THE ROCK OUTCROP, IS FLUSH WITH THE ROCK SURFACE THAT SURROUNDS IT.  IT IS 53 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF LOOKOUT TOWER, 47 FEET SOUTH OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER, AND 25 FEET EAST OF A GUY-PEG, WHICH IS EMBEDDED IN THE BEDROCK.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS A STANDARD DISK STAMPED GUNSTOCK NO 1 1860, IS CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN ROCK OUTCROP, AND IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE ROCK THAT SURROUNDS IT.  IT IS 34 FEET SOUTHEAST OF THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED GUNSTOCK NO 2 1860, IS CEMENTED IN A DRILL HOLE IN ROCK OUTCROP AND IS FLUSH WITH THE SURFACE OF THE ROCK THAT SURROUNDS IT.  IT IS 39.5 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER AND 16.5 FEET NORTHEAST OF A GUY-PEG THAT IS EMBEDDED IN THE BEDROCK.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--4 MILES SOUTHEAST OF GILFORD.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK 21.0 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1989)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NH DEPT OF TRANSP 1989 THE STATION IS LOCATED IN GILFORD, 7.2 KM (4.45 MI) SOUTH-SOUTHEAST OF LACONIA AIRPORT, 8.0 KM (4.95 MI) EAST OF THE CENTER OF LACONIA, 6.6 KM (4.10 MI) WEST OF MOUNT MAJOR IN ALTON, ON TOP OF BELKNAP MOUNTAIN.  OWNERSHIP--STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF BELKNAP MOUNTAIN ROAD AND STATE ROUTE 11-A IN GILFORD, GO SOUTH FOR 1.4 KM (0.85 MI) ON BELKNAP MOUNTAIN ROAD TO GOODWIN ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  STAY LEFT AND GO EAST FOR 0.8 KM (0.50 MI) ON BELKNAP MOUNTAIN ROAD TO WEEKS ROAD ON THE LEFT. BEAR RIGHT ON BELKNAP MOUNTAIN ROAD FOR 1.7 KM (1.05 MI) TO CARRIAGE ROAD. TURN LEFT AND GO 2.65 KM (1.65 MI) ON CARRIAGE ROAD TO THE END OF VEHICLE TRAVEL.  PARK HERE AND HIKE FOR 40 MINUTES ON ANY OF THE 3 WELL-MARKED TRAILS TO THE SUMMIT, THE FIRE LOOKOUT TOWER AND THE STATION. THE STATION IS A COPPER BOLT SURROUNDED BY A CHISELED TRIANGLE IN BEDROCK.  LOCATED 16.2 M (53.1 FT) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST FROM THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER, 14.3 M (46.9 FT) SOUTH FROM THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF THE LOOKOUT TOWER AND 7.6 M (24.9 FT) EAST FROM A GUY PEG EMBEDDED IN THE BEDROCK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1992)  RECOVERED 1992 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2008)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2008 (RG) THE STATION, RM1 AND RM2 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE TO REACH AND DESCRIPTIONS FROM PREVIOUS LOGS ARE CORRECT.  THE STATION IS A COPPER BOLT SET IN BEDROCK WITH A TRIANGLE INSCRIBED AROUND IT.  RM1 AND RM2 ARE STANDARD DISKS.

TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 25 WEST AND INTERSTATE HIGHWAY 93, WHICH IS JUST NORTH OF PLYMOUTH.  GO WEST ON HIGHWAY 25 FOR 4.0 KM (2.5 MI) TO A PAVED ROAD RIGHT, TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHWEST ON THE PAVED ROAD FOR 1.1 KM (0.7 MI) TO A FORK, KEEP LEFT AND GO WEST ON A PAVED ROAD FOR 1.4 KM (0.85 MI) TO A FARM AND THE STATION ON THE LEFT.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD CGS DISK STAMPED---H 35 1955---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT 30 CM IN DIAMETER RECESSED 5 CM BELOW GROUND.  LOCATED 28.65 METERS (94.0 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE EAST CORNER OF THE FARMHOUSE, 17.2 METERS (56.5 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE CENTER OF THE FARM DRIVEWAY, 15.61 METERS (51.2 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM A UTILITY POLE NUMBER 14 57 AND 9.0 METERS (29.5 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM THE CENTER OF THE PAVED ROAD. STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (KTA) STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NE SECTION OF THE TOWN OF HAMPTON, ON THE N SIDE OF WINNICUMMET ROAD, JUST SOUTHERLY OF THE STATE - U.S. ROUTE 1, A WOODEN-CLAPBOARD CHURCH BUILT ABOUT 1835 AND PAINTED WHITE IN 1934.  OVER THE FRONT CENTER WHICH FACES SOUTHERLY, THERE IS A SQUARE TOWER WITH A BLIND IN THE OPENING IN EACH FACE.  THEN THERE IS A SQUARE PYRAMIDAL SPIRE WHICH RISES FROM THE CENTER OF THE ROOF OF THE TOWER AND THE CORNER DIAGONALS OF THE SPIRE ARE AT A 45 DEG ANGLE WITH THE SAME DIAGONALS OF THE TOWER.  THE SPIRE IS CAPPED WITH A GILT BALL AND LIGHTNING ROD.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE FOLLOWING SHOULD BE ADDED TO THE TO THE DESCRIPTION--BALL IS VERY TARNISHED.  CHURCH HAS GREEN SHUTTERS ON FRONT.  SIGN ON CORNER OF CHURCH SAYS FIRST BAPTIST CHURCH.  LISTED IN G.P.S HAMPTON BAPTIST CHURCH, SPIRE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1953)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1953 (PT) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED BY K.T.A. IN 1934.  THE DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (2005)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2005 (JLH) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1928 (CKG) THIS IS AN INTERSECTION STATION.  THE CATHOLIC CHURCH SPIRE IN THE NORTHERN PART OF HAMPTON BEACH.  THE CHURCH IS DARK IN COLOR AND THE SPIRE IS SURMOUNTED BY A CROSS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  SPIRE IS BELL TOWER ON ST. PATRICKS CATHOLIC CHURCH AT HAMPTON BEACH.  BUILDING IS BROWN SHINGLED WITH IVORY TRIMMING ON WINDOWS.  THERE IS A SMALL PARK ON OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE ROAD.  CHURCH HAS BLACK SHINGLED ROOF.  CROSS ON TOP OF SPIRE.  SPIRE IS OCTAGONAL ON SQUARE BELL TOWER.  THIS IS THE SAME STATION AS HAMPTON BEACH, CATHOLIC CHURCH, 1928.                            STATION RECOVERY (1953)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1953 (PT) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED BY F.L.G. IN 1943.  THE DESCRIPTION IS ADEQUATE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1979)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL OCEAN SERVICE 1979 (RCM) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  OBSERVED AZIMUTHS FROM STATIONS ENTRANCE 1928 AND GREAT BOARS HEAD 138 1941 CHECKED.  THE NAME WAS PREVIOUSLY IDENTIFIED AS HAMPTON BEACH ST PAT CATH CH DK SPIRE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1988)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1988 (PD) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2005)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2005 (JLH) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1928 (CKG) LOCATION CHECKED BY PLANE TABLE.  CASINO ENLARGED, BUT HIGHEST CUPOLA WAS NOT CHANGED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (KTA) STATION IS LOCATED IN THE EXTREME SE SECTION OF THE TOWN OF HAMPTON, ABOUT MIDWAY BETWEEN THE HAMPTON HARBOR BRIDGE AND GREAT BOARS HEADS, ON MOST EASTERLY ROAD ALONG THE BEACH, A WOODEN-SHINGLED OCTAGONAL OCTAGONAL CUPOLA WITH A OCTAGONAL DOME-SHAPE ROOF, RISING OVER THE CENTER OF THE RIDGEPOLE OF THE HIGHEST ROOF OF THE GROUP OF BUILDINGS WHICH FORM THE CASINO.  NO DEFINITE DATE OF THE ERECTION OF THE BUILDING COULD BE FOUND, BUT IT IS THE SAME AS IN 1912.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1912 IN THE TOWN OF HAMPTON FALLS ON THE TOP OF GREAT HILL.  THE STATION IS MARKED BY A COPPER BOLT SET IN A ROCK.  THE FOLLOWING MEASUREMENTS ARE FROM THE STATION--OUTCROPPING BOULDER, 26.8 METERS (87.8 FEET) S 41 DEG 03 MIN W.  SPRUCE TREE ON N SIDE OF A FENCE, 65.9 METERS (216.3 FEET).  SMALL BOULDER WITH ARROWHEAD CUT WITH DRILL, 38.3 METERS (125.8 FEET). REFERENCE MARK NO.1, A STANDARD DISK WITH THE ARROW POINTING TOWARD THE STATION, 31.1 METERS (102.1 FEET).  REFERENCE MARK NO.2, A STANDARD DISK REFERENCE MARK WEDGED IN A DRILL HOLE IN A BOULDER, 55.9 METERS (183.4 FEET).                            STATION RECOVERY (1928)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1928 (GCM) STATION MARK FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE FIELD ABOUT THE STATION HAS BEEN BROKEN UP AND THE REFERENCE OUTCROPPING BOULDER AND BOULDER ROCK WITH ARROW CUT IN, LAY IN THE PLOWED GROUND AND WERE NOT RECOVERED.  WITNESS MARK NO.1 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  WITNESS MARK NO.2 RECOVERED, DISK WITNESS MARK IS LOOSE.  THE ROCK ALSO HAS TWO OTHER SHALLOW DRILL HOLES.                            STATION RECOVERY (1928)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1928 (CKG) STATION FOUND AS DESCRIBED.                            STATION RECOVERY (1930)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NEW HAMPSHIRE GEODETIC SURVEY 1930 I VISITED THIS STATION ON DECEMBER 19, 1930 AND WAS ABLE TO DRIVE TO IT IN MY CAR BY FOLLOWING A CART-ROAD FROM THE HOUSE OF W.E. MOORE, WHO IS THE PRESENT OWNER OF THE PROPERTY.  STATION WAS IN GOOD ORDER, WITH THE BOLT FIRMLY IN PLACE.  IT IS LOCATED IN A HAY FIELD AND THE VIEW IS UNOBSTRUCTED.  I FAILED TO FIND THE BOULDER, AND IT WAS PROBABLY REMOVED IN THE CULTIVATION OF THE LAND.  THE SPRUCE TREE DOES NOT EXIST, BUT THERE IS A LARGE WHITE PINE IN APPARENTLY THE SAME PLACE, WHICH MAY BE THE TREE REFERRED TO, AS IT MUST HAVE BEEN THERE FOR MANY YEARS, THE TRUNK BEING ABOUT TWO FEET IN DIAMETER.  THERE ARE NO OTHER LARGE TREES IN THE VICINITY.  THE ARROWHEAD IS HARDLY RECOGNIZABLE AS SUCH AND IS SO INCONSPICUOUS AS TO BE USELESS AS A FINDER.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS FIRMLY IN PLACE, BUT THE DISK IS ABOUT 1-1/2 INCHES ABOVE THE SURFACE OF THE ROCK AND THE ARROW POINTS ABOUT 15 DEG TO THE LEFT OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS LOOSE ENOUGH TO BE EASILY LIFTED OUT AND THE DISK IS ABOUT AN INCH ABOVE THE SURFACE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (FLP) STATION RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  IT IS LOCATED IN THE SOUTHWESTERN SECTION OF THE TOWN OF HAMPTON FALLS, AT THE SUMMIT OF GREAT HILL.  STATION IS IN CLEARED LAND WHICH IS UNDER CULTIVATION. THE FOLLOWING MEASUREMENTS ARE FROM THE STATION--  OUTCROPPING BOULDER, 26.8 METERS, (GONE).  SPRUCE TREE ON N SIDE OF FENCE, 65.9 METERS (GONE).  SMALL BOULDER WITH ARROWHEAD CUT WITH DRILL, 38.3 METERS.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 31.1 METERS.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2.  A GOOD VIEW MAY BE HAD FROM THE STATION IN ALL DIRECTIONS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1936)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NEW HAMPSHIRE GEODETIC SURVEY 1936 ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION CORRECT.  AT PRESENT, THE BOULDER PROJECTS ABOUT 10 INCHES OUT OF THE GROUND, EXPOSING A ROUGHLY CIRCULAR AREA ABOUT 2-1/2 FEET IN DIAMETER.                            STATION RECOVERY (1936)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NEW HAMPSHIRE GEODETIC SURVEY 1936 THIS IS AN OCCUPIED FIRST ORDER STATION.  IT IS LOCATED ON THE S CENTRAL PART OF THE TOWN, ON THE FARM OF MR. SEARS, ON THE TOP OF GREAT HILL, ABOUT 0.3 MILE N FROM HIGHWAY AT A POINT ABOUT 2 MILES W OF ROUTE 1, 91 FEET S OF A STONE WALL AND 216 FEET W OF ANOTHER WALL.  MARK PROJECTS 10 INCHES.  WITNESS MARKS--LARGE WHITE PINE ON E SIDE OF WALL, 216.3 FEET FROM STATION.  ALSO SMALL BOULDER WITH ARROWHEAD CUT WITH DRILL, 125.8 FEET, BUT ARROWHEAD IS NOW RATHER INDISTINCT.  VIEW FROM GROUND IS GOOD IN ALL DIRECTIONS, EXCEPT THAT TWO SMALL GROVES OF PINES TO THE WESTWARD OBSTRUCT THE VIEW IN ARCS OF ABOUT 10 DEG EACH.  STATION MAY BE REACHED FROM WELLSWOOD INN ON ROUTE 1, ABOUT 3 MILES N OF MASS. STATE LINE, BY FOLLOWING HIGHWAY SW AND W 1.6 MILES TO JUNCTION OF TARRED ROAD ON LEFT, AND CONTINUING STRAIGHT AHEAD WESTWARD 0.5 MILE TO THE SEARS FARM.  AN AUTOMOBILE CAN BE DRIVEN NORTHERLY THROUGH THIS FARM, BY WINDING ROAD, 0.3 MILE TO TOP OF HILL.  ATLANTIC WATER TANK IS IN GEODETIC AZIMUTH 328 DEG 14 MIN 54.5 SEC.                            STATION RECOVERY (1941)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (PLB) STATION RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  ALL MARKS FOUND EXCEPT THE ARROW IN BOULDER WHICH HAS PROBABLY BEEN DESTROYED DURING CULTIVATION.  STATION IS LOCATED ON THE SUMMIT OF A GRASS-COVERED HILL, LOCALLY KNOWN AS GREAT HILL, ABOUT 240 FEET IN ELEVATION, ABOUT 1.5 MILES W OF HAMPTON FALLS, 1.2 MILES NW OF SEABROOK, ON THE PROPERTY OF A MR. SEARS WHO LIVES ON THE MAIN ROAD ABOUT 0.25 MILE S OF THE STATION.  IT IS 216 FEET SW OF A LARGE PINE TREE, 89 FEET S AND 217 FEET W OF STONE FENCES.  STATION IS MARKED BY A CROSS IN A BRASS BOLT SET IN A BOULDER WHICH PROTRUDES ABOUT 6 INCHES ABOVE THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK NO.1 IS A STANDARD BRONZE UNSTAMPED DISK SET IN AND PROTRUDING ABOUT 1 INCH ABOVE A BOULDER, JUST N OF A STONE FENCE AND NNW OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.2 IS A STANDARD BRONZE UNSTAMPED DISK SET IN A LARGE BOULDER, NW OF THE LARGE PINE TREE, ABOUT 30 FEET N OF A STONE FENCE, NE OF THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO.3 IS A STANDARD BRONZE DISK, STAMPED HAMPTON FALLS, R.M.3, 1941, SET IN A BOULDER E OF THE STATION, ABOUT 90 FEET S AND 100 FEET W OF STONE FENCES.  STATION IS REACHED FROM WELLSWOOD INN ON U.S. HIGHWAY 1, WHICH IS ABOUT 3 MILES N OF THE MASSACHUSETTS-NEW HAMPSHIRE STATE LINE, BY TAKING A ROAD MARKED KENSINGTON TO THE SW.  FOLLOW THIS MAIN MACADAM ROAD 2.1 MILES TO A HOUSE AND SHINGLE BARN ON THE N AND AN APPLE ORCHARD ON THE S.  THIS IS THE HOME OF MR. SEARS. TURN N ON THE E SIDE OF HIS HOUSE, PASS E OF THE BARN AND FOLLOW A TRAIL ROAD 0.3 MILE TO TOP OF HILL AND STATION.  OBSERVATIONS FROM A 4-FOOT STAND.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) STATION WAS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  AN ADDITIONAL REFERENCE MARK, NOT IN DESCRIPTION, WAS FOUND 37.5 METERS FROM THE STATION

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1928 (CKG) IT IS THE ONLY WHITE CHURCH SPIRE IN THE VICINITY OF HAMPTON FALLS. THE LOCATION OF THE TOWER WAS CHECKED BY PLANE TABLE CUTS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1934)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (FLP) STATION IS LOCATED IN THE E CENTRAL SECTION OF THE TOWN OF HAMPTON FALLS, ON THE N SIDE OF THE GREEN IN THE CENTER, A WOODEN-CLAPBOARD BUILDING KNOWN AS THE BAPTIST CHURCH, BUILT ABOUT 1838 AND PAINTED WHITE IN 1934.  OVER THE FRONT CENTER WHICH FACES SOUTHWESTERLY, THERE IS A SQUARE CLOCK-TOWER SURMOUNTED BY A SLENDER OCTAGONAL SPIRE HAVING AN ORNAMENTAL WOODEN CAP.  THE SPIRE IS FAIRLY PROMINENT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) RECOVERED UNCHANGED.  THE FOLLOWING SHOULD BE ADDED TO THE DESCRIPTION.  GRAY SHUTTERS COVER WINDOWS ON FRONT.  STEPS EXTEND THE FULL LENGTH OF THE FRONT.  BLACK SLATE SHINGLES ON ROOF. LETTERS ON CLOCKS SPELL MEMORIAL GIFT.  STAIN GLASS WINDOWS ON SIDES OF CHURCH.                            STATION RECOVERY (1953)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1953 (PT) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED BY F.L.P. IN 1934.                            STATION RECOVERY (1988)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1988 (PD) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2005)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2005 (JLH) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1941 (PLB) THIS INTERSECTION STATION IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHERN PART OF THE CITY OF HAMPTON AND E OF U.S. HIGHWAY 1.  IT IS NOW PAINTED SILVER AND IS ABOUT 60 FEET HIGH.  IT IS THE ONLY STANDPIPE IN THE IMMEDIATE VICINITY.                            STATION RECOVERY (1943)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (FLG) STATION RECOVERED UNCHANGED.  STANDPIPE IS NOW PAINTED ALUMINUM.  IT IS ACROSS ROAD, W FROM A MR. ROSS HOUSE AND S OF A MR. BENNETTS HOUSE.  IT IS 80 FEET W OF THE CENTER LINE OF ROAD (24.4 METERS) AND IS AT THE INTERSECTION OF TWO ASPHALT ROADS.  THERE IS A LADDER TO TOP ON N SIDE OF STANDPIPE.  ABOUT 1/2 MILE FROM HAMPTON.  THIS IS SAME STATION AS HAMPTON MUNICIPAL STANDPIPE 1941.                            STATION RECOVERY (1953)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1953 (PT) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE DESCRIPTION BY P.L.B. IN 1941 IS ADEQUATE WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONS--  THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE E SIDE OF MILL ROAD, ABOUT 0.3 MI. N OF ITS JUNCTION WITH HIGH STREET.                            STATION RECOVERY (1988)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1988 (MG) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2005)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2005 (JLH) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
PTIVE TEXT AVAILABLE.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1934 (FLP) IN THE EXTREME SOUTHWESTERN SECTION OF THE TOWN OF PLAISTOW, ABOUT 30 FEET NORTHERLY OF THE STATE LINE, ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE ROAD FROM HAVERHILL TO PLAISTOW, THERE IS A WOODEN-CLAPBOARD CHURCH PAINTED A PINK-WHITE IN 1934 AND BUILT ABOUT 1830.  OVER THE FRONT CENTER WHICH FACES SOUTHERLY, THERE IS A SQUARE TOWER.  THEN THERE IS A SMALLER SQUARE BELFRY SURMOUNTED BY A SQUARE PYRAMIDAL MATCHED-BOARD SPIRE CAPPED WITH A BALL AND A LIGHTNING ROD CARRYING A GILT WIND VANE.  THE SPIRE IS NOT PROMINENT.

BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (PLB) STATION IS A 1/2-IN. BRASS PLUG LOCATED OVER THE INSTRUMENT OF THE LOWER FLOOR OF THE H E C P STATION.  IT WAS LOCATED BY DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM STATION H E C P TOP.  THIS IS A TRAVERSE STATION.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (PLB) STATION IS A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED H E C P TOP 1943 AND SET FLUSH IN THE ROOF OF THE H E C P STATION AT FORT STARK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1983)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1983 (ARS) H.E.C.P. - TOP RECOVERED GOOD.  MARK LOCATED IN FT STARK, NEWCASTLE, NH. NEAR PORTSMOUTH, NH.  LOCATED ON TOP OF 3RD LEVEL OF HARBOR ENTRANCE CONTROL PAD ON A CEMENT PAD ON THE SEAWARD SIDE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1994)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1994 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1995)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US POWER SQUADRON 1995 RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2005)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2005 (WD) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

BY NH PUB WORK + HWYS 1961 AT HENNIKER JUNCTION. THIS MARK IS LOCATED AT THE INTERSECTION OF U.S. 202, U.S. 9 AND STATE HIGHWAY 114, THENCE SOUTHEASTERLY ALONG ROUTE 114 ABOUT 1.2 MILES AND 111 FEET SOUTH OF HIGHWAY AND ABOUT 15 FEET ABOVE THE CENTERLINE OF THE ROAD, AND SET IN THE TOP OF A LARGE EMBEDDED BOULDER.
markers.stability: MAY HOLD, BUT OF TYPE COMMONLY SUBJECT TOSURFACE MOTION

markers.description: BY GEODETIC SURVEY OF CANADA 1909 (JDG) IN HEREFORD TOWNSHIP, ABOUT 5 MILES NORTH OF THE INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY AND 6-1/2 MILES NW OF BEECHER FALLS, VERMONT.  IT IS ON AN OUTCROP ON THE HIGHEST POINT OF A HILL COVERED (IN JUNE 1909) WITH THICK BURNED TIMBER AND A THIN SOIL. PROBABLY ON LOT 21, BETWEEN CONCESSIONS V AND VI.  STATION MARK IS A 3/4-INCH COPPER BOLT SURROUNDED BY AN 8-INCH EQUILATERAL TRIANGLE.  THE POINT IS REFERENCED BY 3 3/4-INCH BOLTS LEADED IN ROCK.                            STATION RECOVERY (1959)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1959 (HRL) STATION WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND ALL MARKS FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION.  DUE TO CHANGES IN LAND MARKS AND ROAD NUMBERS, A COMPLETE NEW DESCRIPTION FOLLOWS.  STATION IS LOCATED ON HEREFORD HILL ABOUT 7 MILES NORTHWEST OF CANAAN, VERMONT, ABOUT 5 MILES WEST-NORTHWEST OF HEREFORD, QUEBEC, ABOUT 3-1/2 MILES EAST-NORTHEAST OF VILLETTE, QUEBEC AND ABOUT 5 MILES NORTH OF THE INTERNATIONAL BOUNDRY.  STATION, A COPPER BOLT INSIDE OF AN 8 INCH TRIANGLE TRENCHED IN ROCK OUTCROP AND STAMPED GSC IS ON THE NORTHWEST AND HIGHEST POINT OF HEREFORD HILL AND 17 FEET SOUTHWEST OF A 10 INCH PINE TREE WITH TRIANGLE BLAZE.  THE MARK PROJECTS 2 FEET.  TO REACH FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS NO. 102 AND 114 IN CANAAN, GO WESTERLY ON STATE HIGHWAY NO. 114 FOR 1.2 MILES TO FORKS.  TAKE RIGHT FORK AND GO 0.5 MILE TO U.S.-CANADIAN CUSTOMS.  CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON MAIN ROAD FOR 1.5 MILES TO SIDE ROAD RIGHT JUST BEFORE REACHING CROSSROADS.  TURN RIGHT AND GO NORTHERLY ON GRAVEL ROAD FOR 2.35 MILES TO FORKS. TAKE RIGHT FORK AND CONTINUE NORTHERLY ON LOGGING ROAD FOR 1.35 MILES TO AN OLD LOGGING CAMP AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL. BEAR LEFT AND PACK ALONG OLD LOGGING ROAD FOR ABOUT 0.2 MILE TO A DIM FOOT TRAIL RIGHT.  BEAR RIGHT AND FOLLOW DIM FOOT TRAIL FOR ABOUT 0.2 MILE TO OLD LOGGING ROAD.  FOLLOW OLD LOGGING ROAD FOR ABOUT 0.2 MILE TO END OF LOGGING ROAD.  BEAR RIGHT AND FOLLOW TRAIL UP HILL FOR ABOUT 0.2 MILE TO TOP OF RIDGE.  CONTINUE NORTHWESTERLY ALONG THE TOP OF RIDGE FOR ABOUT 0.4 MILE TO HIGHEST POINT OF HILL AND STATION AS DESCRIBED.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1, A COPPER BOLT SET IN A DRILLHOLE IN OUTCROPPING ROCK IS 8 FEET EAST OF A 10 INCH PINE TREE AND ABOUT 2 FEET LOWER THAN THE STATION.  THE BOLT HAS NO STAMPING.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2, A COPPER BOLT SET IN A DRILLHOLE IN OUTCROPPING ROCK IS 24 FEET SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF A 10 INCH PINE TREE WITH TRIANGLE BLAZE AND ABOUT 2 FEET LOWER THAN THE STATION.  THE MARK HAS NO STAMPING.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 3, A COPPER BOLT SET IN A DRILLHOLE IN OUTCROPPING ROCK IS 15 FEET WEST OF A 10 INCH PINE TREE WITH TRIANGLE BLAZE AND 1 FOOT LOWER THAN THE STATION.  THE MARK HAS NO STAMPING.                            STATION RECOVERY (1971)  RECOVERY NOTE BY INTERNATIONAL BOUNDARY COMMISSION 1971 (NP) STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  NEW DESCRIPTION--LOCATED ON A ROCK OUTCROP ON THE SUMMIT OF HEREFORD MOUNTAIN, ON LOT 19, CONCESSION VI, HEREFORD TOWNSHIP. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE CHURCH IN ST-HERMENEGILDE PROCEED 3.2 MILES ON THE ROAD GOING EAST (RANGE 8), ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE ROAD THERE IS A LARGE FIELD AND A LUMBER TRAIL LEADING TO THE SUMMIT OF THE HILL STARTING FROM AN OPENING IN THE FENCE SOUTH OF THE FIELD.  A TWENTY-FOOT TOWER WAS ERECTED OVER THE STATION. REFERENCED BY 3 COPPER BOLTS LEADED IN THE ROCK.  STATION MARK--A 3/4 INCH COPPER BOLT SURROUNDED BY AN 8-INCH EQUILATERAL TRIANGLE.  A SMALL CUBE OF CONCRETE WITH BRONZE TABLET WAS ERECTED OVER THE BOLT IN 1930.                            STATION RECOVERY (2009)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2009 (RG) THE STATION AND 2 OF THE REFERENCE BOLTS WERE FOUND IN GOOD CONDITION ON ROCK OUTCROPS AT THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE SUMMIT. THE TO REACH DESCRIPTION FROM 1971 IS STILL CORRECT ALTHOUGH THE LOGGING TRAIL TO THE SUMMIT IS NOW A DIRT ROAD NAMED 'THE CENTENNIAL DRIVE' WHICH IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC.   THE STATION IS A 3/4 IN. COPPER BOLT SURROUNDED BY A FAINT 8 IN. TRIANGLE CARVED IN THE ROCK. THE BOLT HAS A CENTER HOLE AND SMALL 1/4 IN. CROSS IN THE CENTER AND THE LETTERS 'G S C 1909' STAMPED ON THE OUTSIDE AND A CIRCLE ABOUT 5/8 IN. IN DIAMETER OUTSIDE OF THE STAMPING. THE LETTER 'S' AND THE SECOND NUMERAL '9' HAVE BEEN DAMAGED.   TWO HOLES, ABOUT 1.5 IN. IN DIAMETER HAVE BEEN DRILLED IN THE ROCK SLIGHTLY TO THE NORTHEAST OF THE STATION JUST OUTSIDE THE CARVED TRIANGLE. THESE ARE PROBABLY THE REMNANTS OF THE ANCHORS FOR THE SMALL CONCRETE CUBE WHICH WAS MOUNTED OVER THE STATION IN 1930 AND WHICH IS NOW GONE.   THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION GIVES LOCATIONS OF THE REFERENCE HOLES WHICH WERE OMITTED FROM THIS DATASHEET.  THIS DESCRIPTION WAS PUBLISHED IN THE IBC REPORT OF 1923 FOR THIS SECTION OF THE BOUNDARY AND IS AS FOLLOWS - STATION MARK- A THREE-FOURTHS INCH COPPER BOLT SURROUNDED BY AN 8-INCH EQUILATERAL TRIANGLE. THE POINT IS REFERENCED BY THREE THREE-FOURTHS INCH BOLTS LEADED IN THE ROCK AT THE FOLLOWING AZIMUTHS AND DISTANCES FROM THE STATION- BOLT NO.1, AZIMUTH 172 DEG 01 MIN 58 SEC, DISTANCE 9.7 FEET, BOLT NO.2, AZIMUTH 255 DEG 45 MIN 38 SEC, DISTANCE 11.35 FEET, BOLT NO.3, AZIMUTH 11 DEG 25 MIN 43 SEC, DISTANCE 8.71 FEET.   TWO 3/4 IN. UNSTAMPED REFERENCE BOLTS WERE FOUND ON NEARBY ROCK OUTCROPS- ONE TO THE NORTHEAST AT AN AZIMUTH OF ABOUT 75 DEGREES AT A DISTANCE OF ABOUT 11.6 FT. AND THE SECOND TO THE SOUTH AT AN AZIMUTH OF ABOUT 190 DEGREES AND A DISTANCE OF ABOUT 8.9 FT. THESE CORRESPOND CLOSELY TO BOLTS 2 AND 3 FROM THE ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION ABOVE, BUT DO NOT CORRESPOND TO THE DATA GIVEN IN THE BOX SCORE WHERE THE AZIMUTHS AND DISTANCES APPEAR TO BE MIXED UP.  THE THIRD REFERENCE BOLT WAS NOT FOUND AND IS LIKELY BURIED UNDER THE NEW PAVILION DESCRIBED BELOW. A CONCRETE PAVILION ABOUT 10 FT. BY 10 FT. SQUARE, SITTING ON A GRAVEL BASE, HAS BEEN RECENTLY CONSTRUCTED ABOUT 20 FT. NORTH OF THE STATION. IT HAS A BRONZE PORTRAIT OF NEIL TILLOTSON IN THE CENTER AND COMPASS DIRECTIONS AND DIRECTIONS TO NEARBY MOUNTAINS AND POINTS OF INTEREST EMBEDDED IN THE CONCRETE.
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1943 (PLB) STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 2.5 MILES NW OF DURHAM, AND ABOUT 4.0 MILES SW OF DOVER, ON THE W END OF A HIGH PROMINENT WOODED HILL, LOCALLY KNOWN AS HICKS HILL, AND ON LAND OWNED BY JOHN S. ELLIOTT.  IT IS 15 FEET N OF AN E-AND-W SKI-TRAIL THAT CROSSES THE HILL, AND 12 FEET E OF A TRIANGULAR-BLAZED 8-INCH PINE TREE.  THE DISK IS STAMPED HICKS HILL 1943 AND PROJECTS 6 INCHES.  SURFACE AND UNDERGROUND MARKS ARE BRONZE STATION DISKS SET IN CONCRETE.  REFERENCE MARKS ARE BRONZE REFERENCE DISKS SET IN DRILL HOLES IN ROCK.  NO AZIMUTH MARK WAS SET.  REFERENCE MARK 1 IS E OF THE STATION, SET IN A BOULDER ABOUT 2 BY 2 FEET IN DIAMETER ON THE S EDGE OF THE SKI-TRAIL.  THE DISK IS STAMPED HICKS HILL NO 1 1943 AND IS SET FLUSH WITH THE ROCK SURFACE.  REFERENCE MARK 2 IS SSW OF THE STATION, SET IN BEDROCK IN MIDDLE OF THE SKI-TRAIL ON THE S SLOPE OF THE HILL.  THE DISK IS STAMPED HICKS HILL NO 2 1943 AND IS SET FLUSH WITH THE ROCK SURFACE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE POST OFFICE IN DURHAM, GO E ON U.S. HIGHWAY 4 FOR 1 BLOCK TO THE FIRST STREET TO THE LEFT, TURN LEFT AND GO N ON MACADAM ROAD FOR 2.4 MILES TO A FORK AT A PARK IN A TRIANGULAR-SHAPED PLOT OF GROUND.  BEAR LEFT AND GO 0.2 MILE TO A CLEARED TRAIL OVER THE HILL ON THE RIGHT, AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM THIS POINT PACK IN AN E DIRECTION TO THE TOP OF THE HILL AND THE TRIANGULAR-BLAZED PINE TREE ON THE LEFT AND THE STATION.  A 64-FOOT TOWER REQUIRED TO CLEAR ALL LINES.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK - 23 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1963)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1963 (GAW) STATION WAS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.  REFERENCE MARKS AND AZIMUTH MARK WERE NOT SEARCHED FOR. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1957 (JBW) THE STATION IS ON A HILL KNOWN LOCALLY AS MT. HUGGINS, ABOUT 2.5 MI. S-SE OF KEENE, NEW HAMPSHIRE, AND 0.5 MI. E OF DILLANT-HOPKINS AIRPORT AT KEENE.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE TRAFFIC CIRCLE IN KEENE, NEW HAMPSHIRE, GO S ON STATE HIGHWAY 12 FOR 1.9 MI. TO ITS JUNCTION WITH STATE HIGHWAY 32, CONTINUE S ON STATE HIGHWAY 12 FOR 1.05 MI. TO A GRAVEL ROAD LEFT AT A CURVE AT THE RIGHT (W) IN STATE HIGHWAY 12.  TURN LEFT ONTO THE GRAVEL ROAD AND GO 0.05 MI. TO THE RAILROAD TRACKS, CROSS TRACKS AND TURN LEFT IMMEDIATELY ONTO A TRACK ROAD LEADING N. CONTINUE N ON THE TRACK ROAD FOR 0.2 MI. TO A Y-FORK, TAKE THE RIGHT FORK (E) AND GO 0.05 MI. TO A LARGE PILE OF ROCKS AND STONES AND THE END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  FROM HERE PACK E AND SE UP THE HILL TO THE HIGHEST POINT AND THE STATION.  ABOUT A 30-MINUTE PACK.  THE STATION, A STANDARD DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN BEDROCK, IS STAMPED HUGGINS 1957.  IT IS 11.50 FT. SOUTH OF AN AERONAUTICAL OBSTRUCTION LIGHT POLE WHICH HAS TWO RED LIGHTS ATOP IT.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN BEDROCK, IS STAMPED HUGGINS NO 1 1957.  IT IS ABOUT 3 FT. LOWER THAN THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN BEDROCK, IS STAMPED HUGGINS NO 2 1957.  IT IS ABOUT 5 FT. LOWER THAN THE STATION.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH MARK FROM THE TRAFFIC CIRCLE IN KEENE, GO S ON STATE HIGHWAY 12 FOR 1.9 MI. TO ITS JUNCTION WITH STATE HIGHWAY 32 AND SIGN TO AIRPORT.  TURN LEFT ONTO STATE HIGHWAY 32 AND GO SW FOR 0.7 MI. TO ENTRANCE TO DILLANT-HOPKINS AIRPORT.  TURN RIGHT INTO AIRPORT AND CONTINUE TO ADMINISTRATION BUILDING, HERE PASS THROUGH GATE ONTO THE NW-SE TAXIWAY.  FOLLOW TAXIWAY NW FOR 0.1 MI. TO THE NW CORNER OF LANDING STRIP NO. 20.  THE AZIMUTH MARK, A STANDARD DISK STAMPED HUGGINS 1947, IS SET IN THE TOP OF AN 8-IN. SQUARE CONCRETE POST WHICH IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND. THE MARK IS SET IN THE NW CORNER OF THE NW END OF LANDING STRIP NO. 20.                            STATION RECOVERY (1957)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1957 (FBM) THE STATION AND BOTH REFERENCE MARKS WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.  OBSERVATIONS TO THE AZIMUTH MARK DID NOT CHECK WITH THE OBSERVATIONS (TAKEN BY THE PARTY OF J.B.W., JR. DURING APRIL OF 1957) BY 44 MIN AND 33 SEC.  APPARENTLY THE PREVIOUS OBSERVATIONS WERE MISTAKENLY TAKEN ON A RUNWAY LIGHT.  THE TRUE AZIMUTH TO THE AZIMUTH MARK IS 98 DEG 50 MIN 45.4 SEC INSTEAD OF 99 DEG 35 MIN 19.0 SEC.                            STATION RECOVERY (1958)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1958 (LFV) STATION, AZIMUTH AND REFERENCE MARKS RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION. ANGLE BETWEEN AZIMUTH MARK AND REFERENCE MARKS AND DISTANCES TO REFERENCE MARKS CHECKED AND VERIFIED.  DESCRIPTION ADEQUATE AND CORRECT BY J.B.W., JR.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (FLJ) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND IT IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  RMS 1 AND 2 WERE ALSO RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.  AZIMUTH MARK HUGGINS-1957, LOCATED AT THE DILLANT-HOPKINS AIRPORT WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND IS ALSO IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1974)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1974 (BGH) SHANK OF STATION DISK IS STILL IN PLACE BUT THE DISK HAS BEEN SHEARED OFF.  RM 1 AND RM 2 WERE RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION AS DESCRIBED.  AIRLINE DISTANCE AND DIRECTION FROM NEAREST TOWN--2.5 MILES S.S.E. OF KEENE, N.H.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NH PUB WORK + HWYS 1984 (KWL) THE ORIGINAL TO REACH WAS ADEQUATE.  THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE RECOVERED IN THEIR DESCRIBED LOCATIONS.  THE TOPS OF ALL THREE DISKS HAD BEEN REMOVED, ONLY THEIR STEMS REMAINED.  THE DISKS WERE NOT REPLACED, THE STEMS WERE USED AS THE CONTROL POINTS.  THE AZIMUTH MARK WAS SEARCHED FOR EXTENSIVELY BUT NOT RECOVERED, IT WAS POSSIBLY DESTROYED BY CONSTRUCTION.  THE ANGLE BETWEEN REFERENCE MARKS CHECKED THE 1957 ANGLE WITHIN TWO SECONDS.  THE DISTANCE TO RM 1 AND RM 2 CHECKED THE 1957 MEASUREMENTS WITHIN 1 MM AND 2 MM RESPECTIVELY. NO MEASUREMENTS BETWEEN REFERENCE MARKS WERE MADE DUE TO BRUSH ON LINE.  THE STATION IS THE STEM OF THE ORIGINAL DISK SURROUNDED BY LEAD.  SET INTO A LARGE ROCK OUTCROP AT THE HIGHEST POINT OF THE HILL.  2.9 METERS (9.5 FT) SOUTH FROM A STEEL POLE WITH A BEACON ON TOP.  1.7 METERS (5.5 FT) NORTH FROM AN ANCHOR BOLT.  7.1 METERS (23.2 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM AN ANCHOR BOLT ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE OUTCROP.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS THE STEM OF THE ORIGINAL DISK SURROUNDED BY LEAD, STAMPED---RM 1---, SET INTO A ROCK OUTCROP 17.0 METERS (55.7 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM A STEEL POLE WITH A BEACON, 12.7 METERS (41.7 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM AN ANCHOR BOLT AND 17.5 METERS (57.4 FT) SOUTH FROM AN ANCHOR BOLT ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE ROCK OUTCROP.  THE MARK IS 1.0 METER BELOW THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS THE STEM OF THE ORIGINAL DISK SURROUNDED BY LEAD STAMPED---RM 2---, SET INTO ROCK OUTCROP, 8.1 METERS (26.7 FT) WEST FROM A STEEL POLE WITH BEACON ON TOP AND 9.0 METERS (29.6 FT) WEST FROM AN ANCHOR BOLT IN THE ROCK OUTCROP.  THE MARK IS 2.0 METERS BELOW THE STATION.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT SHOWN WAS 1.5 METERS ABOVE THE MARK.  THE STATION IS ON PROPERTY OWNED BY IRENE UNDERWOOD OF KEENE, NH.

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1957 (JBW) THE STATION IS A STANDARD U.S. GEOLOGICAL SURVEY BENCH-MARK DISK.  THE DISK IS UNSTAMPED EXCEPT FOR THE ELEVATION OF 1510 FT.  THE MARK IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN THE CENTER CONCRETE FOOTING OF HYLAND HILL FIRE LOOKOUT TOWER.  THE LOOKOUT TOWER IS A STEEL STRUCTURE 70 FT. IN HEIGHT WITH A WOODEN HOUSE ON TOP.  A WOODEN PLATFORM IS BELOW THE HOUSE AND 43 FT. ABOVE GROUND.  THIS IS AN INTERSECTION STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (FLJ) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN THE U.S.C. AND G.S. 1957 DESCRIPTION. THE MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION.  THE STATION MARK IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. BENCH MARK WITH AN ELEVATION OF 1510 FT. STAMPED ON IT.
markers.stability: PROBABLY HOLD POSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1957 (JBW) THE STATION IS ON A PROMINENT HILL KNOWN LOCALLY AS HYLAND HILL, ABOUT 4 MI. NW OF KEENE, NEW HAMPSHIRE, AND AT THE SITE OF THE HYLAND FIRE LOOKOUT TOWER.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE TRAFFIC CIRCLE AT KEENE, NEW HAMPSHIRE, GO W ON STATE HIGHWAYS 9 (E) AND 12 (N) FOR 1.4 MI. TO THE JUNCTION OF THESE HIGHWAYS AT A Y-FORK.  TAKE THE LEFT FORK AND CONTINUE W ON STATE HIGHWAY 9 FOR 0.8 MI. TO A PAVED ROAD RIGHT AND SIGN HURRICANE ROAD.  TURN RIGHT ONTO HURRICANE ROAD AND GO W AND NW FOR 2.6 MI. AND THE END OF THE PAVED SURFACE, CONTINUE ON THE MAIN TRAVELED ROAD ALONG THE RIDGE FOR 0.95 MI. TO A TRACK ROAD LEFT AND SIGN HIGHLAND HILL LOOKOUT TOWER, TURN LEFT ONTO THE TRACK ROAD AND CONTINUE UPHILL W AND SW FOR 0.75 MI. TO A Y-FORK AND SIGN LOOKOUT TOWER, TAKE THE LEFT FORK, PASS THROUGH GATE AND CONTINUE UPHILL (S) FOR 0.4 MI. TO THE TOP OF THE HILL, THE LOOKOUT TOWER, AND THE STATION.  THE STATION MARK, A STANDARD DISK, STAMPED HYLAND 1957, IS SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN BEDROCK.  THE MARK, THE SMALL AIR HOLE IN THE DISK JUST OUTSIDE OF THE TRIANGLE ON THE DISK, IS 9.05 FT. SE OF THE NW TOWER LEG, 12.56 FT. NW OF THE SE TOWER LEG, 13.64 FT. NE OF THE SW TOWER LEG, 16.39 FT. SW OF THE NE TOWER LEG, AND ABOUT 1 FT. BELOW THE SURFACE OF THE GROUND.  REFERENCE MARK 1, A STANDARD DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN BEDROCK, STAMPED HYLAND NO 1 1957, IS 17.6 FT. S OF THE SE CORNER OF THE FIRE-WARDENS HOUSE, PROJECTS ABOUT 1 FT. AND IS AT ABOUT THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK 2, A STANDARD DISK SET IN A DRILL HOLE IN BEDROCK, STAMPED HYLAND NO 2 1957, IS 0.9 FT. W OF THE NW ANCHOR BOLT AND GUY-WIRE OF THE TOWER, PROJECTS ABOUT 0.5 FT. AND IS AT THE SAME ELEVATION AS THE STATION.  THERE WAS NO SUITABLE PLACE FOR AN AZIMUTH MARK, HOWEVER THE CROSS ON TOP OF THE CUPOLA OF THE CHESHIRE COUNTY COURT HOUSE IN KEENE, NEW HAMPSHIRE, MAY BE USED AS AN AZIMUTH.  HEIGHT OF LIGHT ABOVE STATION MARK - 13 METERS.                            STATION RECOVERY (1957)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1957 (FBM) THE STATION WAS RECOVERED AS PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED BY J.B. WATKINS, JR., AND WAS FOUND TO BE IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1964)  RECOVERY NOTE BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1964 (FLJ) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED AND THE STATION MARK IS IN GOOD CONDITION. REFERENCE MARKS 1 AND 2 WERE ALSO RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION. IN THE VICINITY OF THIS STATION MARK IS A STANDARD U.S.G.S. BENCH MARK DISC.  ITS ONLY IDENTIFICATION IS THE STAMPED ELEVATION--1510 FT.                            STATION RECOVERY (1984)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NH PUB WORK + HWYS 1984 (KWL) THE STATION AND REFERENCE MARK 2 WERE RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED IN GOOD CONDITION.  REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS FOUND WITH THE TOP SHEARED OFF.  THE STEM WAS IN THE DRILL HOLE AND WAS USED AS THE REFERENCE MARK AT THIS TIME.  THE ANGLE BETWEEN THE STEM OF REFERENCE MARK 1 AND REFERENCE MARK 2 FAILED TO CHECK THE 1957 OBSERVATIONS BY 2 MINUTES, 30 SECONDS. THE TAPED MEASUREMENT TO REFERENCE MARK 1 WAS 46 MM (1-13/16 INCH) SHORTER THAN THE PREVIOUS MEASUREMENT AND THE MEASUREMENT TO REFERENCE MARK 2 WAS 24 MM (15/16 INCH) SHORTER THAN THE PREVIOUS MEASUREMENT.  NO MEASUREMENT WAS MADE BETWEEN THE REFERENCE MARKS DUE TO BRUSH ON LINE.  HYLAND USGS WAS RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THE TAPED DISTANCE FROM THE STATION WAS 1.083 M (3.6 FT) WHICH IS 0.010 M (0.0 FT) LONGER THAN THE 1957 MEASUREMENT.  THE STATION IS BURIED BELOW GROUND AND SET IN BEDROCK SO THERE IS NO REASON TO BELIEVE THAT IT MOVED.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY DISK STAMPED---HYLAND 1957---, SET INTO ROCK OUTCROP AT THE BASE OF THE FIRE LOOKOUT TOWER.  2.7 M (8.9 FT) SOUTHEAST FROM THE NORTHWEST LEG OF THE FIRE TOWER.  3.8 M (12.5 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM THE NORTHEAST LEG OF THE FIRE TOWER.  5.0 M (16.4 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE SOUTHEAST LEG OF THE FIRE TOWER.  4.1 M (13.5 FT) NORTHEAST FROM THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF THE FIRE TOWER.  1.2 M (3.9 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE CENTER OF THE FIRE TOWER.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 1 IS THE STEM OF THE OLD DISK SURROUNDED BY LEAD. STAMPED---RM 1---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A 4-FOOT BY 18-FOOT ROCK OUTCROP.  32.61 M (107.0 FT) WEST FROM THE SOUTHWEST LEG OF THE TOWER.  6.86 M (22.5 FT) EAST FROM A LARGE TWIN HEMLOCK.  1.68 M (5.5 FT) EAST FROM THE WEST END OF THE ROCK OUTCROP.  MARK IS 0.6 M (2.0 FT) BELOW THE STATION.  REFERENCE MARK NO. 2 IS A STANDARD NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY DISK STAMPED---HYLAND 1957 NO 2---, SET INTO A ROCK OUTCROP.  18.72 M (61.4 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE FIRE TOWER.  7.92 M (26.0 FT) WEST FROM THE CENTER OF THE GRAVEL ROAD.  0.27 M (0.9 FT) EAST FROM THE NORTHWEST ANCHOR BOLT.  MARK IS 0.6 M (2.0 FT) BELOW THE STATION.
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL

markers.description: BY WOOLPERT CONSULTANTS 1998 (BBS) DESCRIBED BY WOOLPERT LLP 1998 (ARL) .  THE STATION IS LOCATED APPROXIMATELY 9.0 KM (5.60 MI) EAST OF NEWMARKET, 5.1 KM (3.15 MI) SOUTH OF THE MAINE AND NEW HAMPSHIRE STATE LINE, 4.7 KM (2.90 MI) WEST OF PORTSMOUTH, AT THE PEASE INTERNATIONAL TRADEPORT. OWNERSHIP--STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE, C/O WILLIAM HOPPER AIRPORT OPERATIONS MANAGER, PEASE DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY, PEASE INTERNATIONAL TRADEPORT, 360 CORPORATE DRIVE, PORTSMOUTH NH 03801, PHONE NUMBER 603-433-6536, FAX NUMBER 603-334-6135.  THIS STATION IS LOCATED IN THE AIRFIELD RESTRICTED AREA WHICH MAKES THIS POINT INACCESSIBLE TO THE MAJORITY OF NON-AIRPORT USERS.  CONTACT THE AIRPORT OPERATIONS MANAGER FOR MORE INFORMATION. TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF STATE HIGHWAYS 4 AND 16 (SPAULDING TURNPIKE) AND PEASE BOULEVARD, PROCEED SOUTHWEST 1.0 KM (0.60 MI) TO THE JUNCTION OF NEW HAMPSHIRE AVENUE.  TURN LEFT AND PROCEED SOUTHEAST 0.3 KM (0.20 MI) ALONG NEW HAMPSHIRE AVENUE TO THE JUNCTION OF EXETER ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND PROCEED SOUTHWEST 0.40 KM (0.25 MI) ALONG EXETER ROAD TO THE JUNCTION OF AIRLINE ROAD ON THE RIGHT.  TURN RIGHT AND PROCEED NORTHWEST 0.2 KM (0.10 MI) ALONG AIRLINE ROAD TO THE AIRPORT MAINTENANCE DEPARTMENT AND THE FIRE STATION ON THE LEFT WITH GATE 13 BETWEEN THE TWO BUILDINGS. TURN LEFT AND PROCEED 0.08 KM (0.05 MI) THROUGH GATE 13 AND ALONG THE APRON TO FLIGHT LINE ROAD (UNMARKED) . TURN LEFT AND PROCEED SOUTH 1.8 KM (1.10 MI) ALONG FLIGHT LINE ROAD TO THE JUNCTION OF LOWRY LANE. PROCEED SOUTH 0.3 KM (0.20 MI) ALONG LOWRY LANE PAST GATE 1 ON THE LEFT TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT, NORTH OF A BROWN BUILDING.  THE STATION IS AN ALUMINUM DISK STAMPED--ILS BENCHMARK ARRAY SYSTEM DEGREE 2 LENGTH DOWN RUNWAY 13712.57-- SET BY THE NEW HAMPSHIRE AIR NATIONAL GUARD IN A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  NOTE--THE DISK OR MONUMENT IS SLIGHTLY METALLIC SO THAT A WEAK SIGNAL IS RETURNED BY A METAL DETECTOR.  THE STATION IS LOCATED 1.43 M (4.69 FT) NORTH 80 DEGREES EAST OF ANOTHER CONCRETE MONUMENT WITH A 0.04 M (0.13 FT) DIAMETER DISK ON IT, 17.07 M (56.00 FT) DUE WEST OF A CHAINLINK PERIMETER FENCE, AND 13.38 M (43.90 FT) DUE WEST OF THE CENTERLINE OF LOWRY LANE.  THIS STATION IS DESIGNATED AS A SECONDARY AIRPORT CONTROL STATION.                            STATION RECOVERY (1999)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1999 (ED) RECOVERED AS DESCRIBED.  THE DISK IS AN ALUMINUM DISK SET BY THE NEW HAMPSHIRE AIR NATIONAL GUARD.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 2012 (TGW) RECOVERED IN GOOD CONDITION.                            STATION RECOVERY (2017)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOPRO CONSULTANTS LLC 2017 (CTS) MONUMENT HAS BEEN HIT REPEATEDLY BY A LAWN-MOWER BLADE AND THE DATUM  POINT ON THE DISK IS NO LONGER DISCERNIBLE.
markers.setting: SET IN TOP OF CONCRETE MONUMENT

markers.description: BY NEW HAMPSHIRE AIR NATIONAL GUARD 1970 THE STATION IS LOCATED ON THE NORTHEAST QUADRANT OF THE PEASE INTERNATIONAL TRADEPORT.  OWNERSHIP - STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE, C/O WILLIAM HOPPER, AIRPORT OPERATIONS MANAGER, PEASE DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY, PEASE INTERNATIONAL TRADEPORT, 360 CORPORATE DRIVE, PORTSMOUTH,NH 03801, TELEPHONE NUMBER 603 433 6536, FAX NUMBER 603 334 6135.  THIS STATION IS LOCATED IN THE AIRFIELD RESTRICTED AREA. AIRPORT OPERATIONS MUST BE CONTACT TO GAIN ACCESS TO THE STATION.  TO REACH FROM THE AIRPORT OPERATIONS BLDG AND GATE 13.  PROCEED WEST FOR .1 MI (0.2 KM) FROM GATE AND BLDG ON RAMP TO TAXIWAY N AND TAXIWAY A INTERSECTION, TURN RIGHT AND PROCEED NORTH FOR 1.1 MI (1.8 KM) TO THE END OF THE TAXIWAY.  CONTINUE ON A DIM TRACK ROAD FOR .05 MI (0.08 KM) TO THE STATION ON THE RIGHT.  THE STATION IS AN ALUMINUM DISK STAMPED ILS 35 X 98425 SET IN THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE POST THAT IS FLUSH WITH THE GROUND.  THE STATION IS 230 FT (70.1 M) NORTH OF THE NORTHERN EDGE OF TAXIWAY, 126.6 FT (38.6 M) NORTHEAST OF A BROWN EQUIPMENT BLDG.  , 15.7 FT (4.8 M) NORTHEAST OF THE DIM TRACK ROAD.

markers.description: BY US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY 1878 (ETQ) TO REACH STATION GO FROM GATES COTTAGE DOWN THE ANDROSCOGGIN 3 MILES TO A SMALL POND ON THE LEFT.  TAKE THE LEFT-HAND ROAD THROUGH A PAIR OF BARS OF AN OLD MILL, ONE MILE FROM THE MAIN ROAD.  FOLLOW A LOGGING ROAD ON THE LEFT SIDE OF INGALLS BROOK (ON WHICH THE SAWMILL STANDS) OVER 3 OR 4 FENCES, ALONG THE LEFT BRANCH OF THE BROOK ACROSS A SMALL BRANCH COMING FROM THE LEFT, TO A POINT 3-1/2 MILES BEYOND THE MILL WHERE THE ROAD CROSSES THE BROOK OBLIQUELY OVER A SMOOTH LEDGE.  FOLLOW THE SAME LOGGING ROAD 1/2 MILE FURTHER TO A LOG CAMP ON THE RIGHT.  THE COMPASS BEARING OF THE ROAD IS ABOUT 10 DEG E OF N.  THE UPPER END OF ROAD IS GROWN UP TO BUSHES, NOT HAVING BEEN USED FOR SOME YEARS.  FROM THE LOG CABIN FOLLOW A LINE OF SPOTTED TREES, (STARTING WITH A COMPASS BEARING N 6 DEG E) OVER THE TOP OF A PEAK, MOSTLY COVERED WITH BUSHES, FROM WHICH A VIEW OF INGALLS IS OBTAINED.  THE SPOTTED TREES CONTINUE TOWARD THE TOP OF INGALLS, COMING OUT WHERE A FIRE RAN 2 YEARS AGO, THEN BEAR TO THE RIGHT AND FOLLOW A PATH ACROSS TWO CRANBERRY MEADOWS TO THE HIGHEST POINT.  STATION IS WHERE THE SIGNAL POLE STANDS ON LEDGE.  THERE ARE SEVERAL LEDGES OF ABOUT THE SAME HEIGHT.  STATION IS IN THE CENTER OF A TRENCH RUNNING A LITTLE NW AND SE AND IS ABOUT 4 MILES FROM LOG CABIN. STATION IS SE OF SUCCESS.  IT IS IN CHARGE OF HENRY P. GATES, OF SHELBURNE.                            STATION RECOVERY (1959)  RECOVERY NOTE BY US FOREST SERVICE 1959 (FSB) RECOVERED STATION AS DESCRIBED.  NEW ROUTE--FROM ROUTE 16 AT THE WEST END OF THE BERLIN MILLS BRIDGE, DRIVE EAST OVER BRIDGE 0.2 MILE TO HUTCHINS STREET, TURN RIGHT, GO 0.4 MILE TO SUCCESS POND ROAD ON LEFT, TURN LEFT, AT 0.1 MILE CROSS RR, AT 0.6 MILE PASS UNDER POWER LINE, AT 1.15 MILES SIDE ROAD LEFT, AT 2.3 MILES CROSS BEAN BROOK, AT 3.55 MILES SIDE ROAD RIGHT, AT 4.15 MILES CROSS BRIDGE, AT 5.35 MILES CROSS FORD, AT 5.4 MILES CROSS BRIDGE, AT 5.6 MILES AMC TRAIL ON LEFT AND END OF TRUCK TRAVEL.  PACK UP TRAIL TO JUNCTION WITH MAHOOSUC TRAIL, BEAR RIGHT ALONG MAHOOSUC TRAIL TO SUMMIT AND STATION.  PACK 1-1/2 HOURS.  TRAIL WELL MAINTAINED. STATION MARK IS IRON BOLT 0.36 FEET HIGH AND IS WITNESSED BY (1) A BENT IRON BOLT LYING NW 8.78 FEET, (2) A BENT IRON BOLT LYING NE 8.67 FEET, AND (3) A GROUP OF NAILS IN A DRILL HOLE SOUTH 8.89 FEET.  AN UNSTAMPED USGS TABLET LIES NORTH 0.21 FEET.                            STATION RECOVERY (2012)  RECOVERY NOTE BY GEOCACHING 2012 (CDH) RECOVERED GOOD CONDITION. THE TWO WITNESS BOLTS AND THE DISK ALSO IN GOOD CONDITION. COULD NOT LOCATE OTHER WITNESS MARK AT THIS TIME. TO REACH MARK FROM SUCCESS POND ROAD, HIKE THE SUCCESS TRAIL TO THE MAHOOSUC TRAIL TO THE SUMMIT. MARK IS QUITE PROMINENT ON ROCK CROPPING.

BY COAST SURVEY (CGS) 1876 (ETQ) THE TOP IS MOSTLY LEDGE.  SIGNAL IS ON HIGH PEAK.  TO REACH FROM SANDWICH CENTER GO TO HOUSE OF L.Q. FIRE LOOKOUT IS GONE.  POINT IS WITNESSED BY TWO IRON BOLTS AND THE STUBS OF A THIRD ONE USED TO GUY ORIGINAL SIGNAL.  SUGGESTED ROUTE IS TO DRIVE TO THE BOY SCOUT CAMP AT MEAD BASE AND THEN PACK UP WENTWORTH TRAIL.  ONE HOUR AND 20 MINUTES. TRAIL IS MAINTAINED AT THIS TIME.

markers.description: BY NATIONAL GEODETIC SURVEY 1986 (REP) THE STATION IS LOCATED ABOUT 1.6 KM (1.0 MI) EAST-SOUTHEAST OF JAFFREY, 0.15 KM (0.1 MI) SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF STATE HIGHWAY 124, AT THE JAFFREY MUNICIPAL AIRPORT, AT THE NORTHWEST END OF THE AIRPORT, IN A GRASS STRIP BETWEEN THE PARKING LOT AND THE TARMAC.  OWNERSHIP--TOWN OF JAFFREY, C/O HARVEY SAWYER, JAFFREY MUNICIPAL AIRPORT, JAFFREY NH 03452, PHONE 603-532-8870.  TO REACH THE STATION FROM THE JUNCTION OF U.S. HIGHWAY 202 EAST AND STATE HIGHWAY 124 IN JAFFREY, GO SOUTHEAST ON HIGHWAY 124 FOR 1.1 KM (0.7 MI) TO THE JAFFREY FIRE DEPARTMENT ON THE RIGHT.  CONTINUE AHEAD FOR 0.4 KM (0.25 MI) TO A PAVED ROAD RIGHT, BEAR RIGHT AND GO SOUTHEAST FOR 0.2 KM (0.1 MI) TO THE END OF THE ROAD, AT TARMAC AND AIRCRAFT GAS PUMPS AND THE STATION ON THE RIGHT AT CORNER OF PARKING LOT.  THE STATION IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---JAFFREY 1986---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT 30 CM IN DIAMETER RECESSED 2 CM BELOW GROUND.  LOCATED 17.7 METERS (58.1 FT) NORTH FROM THE NORTHWEST ONE OF TWO GAS PUMPS, 8.7 METERS (28.5 FT) SOUTH FROM THE SOUTH CORNER OF BRICK CHIMNEY TO PRIVATE RESIDENCE, 6.3 METERS (20.7 FT) NORTHEAST FROM A 0.3 METER SQUARE CONCRETE BLOCK PROJECTING 0.3 METER, 2.9 METERS (9.5 FT) NORTH FROM A LARGE FENCE CORNER POST AT THE WEST CORNER OF THE PARKING LOT, 2.6 METERS (8.5 FT) NORTHWEST FROM THE PARKING LOT EDGE.  THE UNDERGROUND MARK IS A STANDARD NGS DISK STAMPED---JAFFREY 1986---, SET INTO AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 1.2 METERS BELOW THE SURFACE.  THE AZIMUTH MARK IS A STANDARD NGS REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED ---JAFFREY AZI 1986---, SET INTO THE TOP OF A ROUND CONCRETE MONUMENT 30 CM IN DIAMETER RECESSED 15 CM BELOW GROUND.  LOCATED 9.2 METERS (30.2 FT) SOUTH FROM THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE LETTER Y PAINTED ON THE TAXI STRIP, 7.4 METERS (24.3 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM THE CENTER OF A TAXI STRIP AND 1.2 METERS (3.9 FT) SOUTHWEST FROM THE EDGE OF THE PAVEMENT.  TO REACH THE AZIMUTH FROM THE STATION, GO SOUTHEAST FOR 0.5 KM (0.3 MI) ACROSS THE TARMAC AND FOLLOW THE LOWER TAXI STRIP TO THE MARK ON THE RIGHT AT THE LETTER Y IN THE WORD JAFFREY, WHICH IS PAINTED ON THE TAXI STRIP IN 8 METER HIGH LETTERS.  THE UNDERGROUND MARK IS A STANDARD NGS REFERENCE MARK DISK STAMPED ---JAFFREY AZI 1986---, SET INTO AN IRREGULAR MASS OF CONCRETE 1.2 METERS BELOW THE SURFACE.  FAA AIRPORT SURVEYS, NEW ENGLAND, SEPTEMBER-OCTOBER 1986.  THIS STATION IS SUITABLE FOR GPS SURVEYS.  DESCRIBED BY G.R. HEID. markers.description: BY COAST AND GEODETIC SURVEY 1961 (RCY) STATION NOT RECOVERED AND BELIEVED TO BE DESTROYED.  FROM LOCAL INQUIRY IT WAS LEARNED THAT A PLATFORM WAS BUILT IN A TALL PINE TREE ON THIS HILL BY A MR. BUTLER WHO THEN OWNED THE PROPERTY.  THE HILL WAS CLEARED OF TIMBER IN 1918 AND A STATE FIRE LOOKOUT TOWER WAS ERECTED IN 1919 ON THE HIGHEST PART OF THE HILL.

markers.description: BY COAST SURVEY (CGS) 1873 (ETQ) TO REACH GO TO MR. GEORGE AUSTIN WASSONS HOUSE ON W SIDE, ABOUT 4-1/2 MILES FROM MT. VERNON, AND ABOUT 2 MILES FROM NEW BOSTON.  THE TOP OF THE HILL IS COVERED BY A GROWTH OF RATHER HEAVY TIMBER BUT FREE FROM BRUSH AND UNDERWOOD.  THE TREES RANGE FROM 40 TO 70 FEET IN HEIGHT.  A VERY PRACTICABLE ROAD LEADS (FOR HORSE AND BUGGY) TO THE HIGHEST GROUND.  A SIGNAL MIGHT BE MADE IF THE POINT IS OF SUFFICIENT IMPORTANCE, BY TRIMMING A TREE ON THE HIGHEST RISE OF LAND AND LASHING TO THE TOP A POLE RISING 12 TO 15 FEET ABOVE IT.

markers.description: BY COAST SURVEY (CGS) 1873 (ETQ) THE BEST WAY TO REACH THE SUMMIT IS TO GO FROM POTTER PLACE, ON THE NORTHERN NEW HAMPSHIRE RAILROAD TO THE WINSLOW HOUSE ON THE N SIDE OF THE MOUNTAIN.  THIS IS ABOUT 1,000 FEET BELOW THE SUMMIT AND FROM 3/4 TO 1-1/4 MILES DISTANT.  THE ASCENT IS DIFFICULT FROM THE WINSLOW HOUSE, IF THE DIRECT ROUTE IS TAKEN OVER THE LEDGES.  BUT LESS SO IF THE LONGER ROUTE BY THE MULE PATH IS FOLLOWED.  THE SUMMIT IS A VAST ROCKY LEDGE.  THE SIGNAL STATION IS MARKED BY A HOLE DRILLED INTO THE ROCK, HOLDING A LEAD BOLT.  THE HOLE IS DRILLED WITHIN A CIRCLE CUT IN THE ROCK TO MARK THE LINE BETWEEN WILMOT AND WARNER TOWNSHIPS.  THE SIGNAL IS ON THE HIGHEST POINT. IT IS IN CHARGE OF CHASE AND HOWE, WINSLOW HOUSE, WILMOT, OR POTTER PLACE, ANDOVER, NEW HAMPSHIRE.
markers.stability: MOST RELIABLE AND EXPECTED TO HOLDPOSITION/ELEVATION WELL
